Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, terrible food, bring lots of money”
Reviews.Author: greenskyes
Reviews.Content: The rooms and pool were beautiful. The gym doesn't open until 8am, so I didn't get to work out at all during our stay since I like to get it done before breakfast. There is a well equipped kitchen in our room so we went grocery shopping and were able to cook some meals to save money. However, buying your own booze is kind of a waste unless you are slick enough to sneak it into the pool area. There is no outside food or drink allowed in the common areas which is especially insulting since the drinks you buy at the lounge are VERY expensive and watered down. They have cans of beer for $5.50 each. Also, a breakfast burrito is upwards of $10 so eat in your room as much as possible. I would also suggest ordering from the local restaurants. The food is much better and much cheaper and they are glad to deliver! The website boasted a shuttle to the strip and a rooftop garden. Neither of these things existed when we were there. Since the shuttle was not running and cab fare is expensive, we rented a car. The wi-fi is not included and requires a half an hour of setting up an account with AT&T. The best part of the resort is the pool area, as long as you're smart enough to make your own drinks in the resort's cups and sneak them in. There weren't any real activities and there was no night life. Overall, a nice place for families but bring lots of cash, as they nickel and dime you to death. I would stay there again, but only because we stay cheap using a timeshare. If you have to pay a regular rate or are traveling as a romantic getaway or are looking to be wowed, I'd suggest staying closer to town or somewhere with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: rrshep52
Reviews.Content: We traded our units at Tahiti Village for three of the one-bedroom units at this resort in April and had great service from check in to check out. Everyone at the reservation and concierge desk were very accomodating for our large party. The service staff also attended to all our requests and needs. The only issue we had during our stay was a party going on till late hours in an adjoining unit. When I mentioned it at check out, I was told that the quiet time started at 10:00 pm and that we should have called. One item to mention too is that we had one unit on the pool side which had a beautiful view but the music being played at the pool in the evenings was very loud. Our one bedroom unit had a pull out sofa in the living room to allow for accomodations for 4 people. The bedroom size was adequate. There was a large adjoining bathroom with a whirlpool tub that could fit 2 people. There was also another full bath off the living room and folding doors in the living room doorway that you could use to create a private space. The kitchen was small but had necessary equipment and dishes. There was no washer or dryer in the unit but laundry facilities were available. I would definitely recommend this resort when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway from the Strip-Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lynn F
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the fun of Las Vegas but need a refuge from the overstimulating glitz of the Strip, this is the perfect place to stay. We came with our teenager and two seniors and found Cancun to be extremely accommodating of everyone's needs. The grounds were exceptionally clean and comfortable, with pools for kids and adults (lifeguard included),saunas, and shaded hammocks for afternoon napping. Our 2-bedroom villa with full kitchen was well equipped for eating in, and offered enough space so as not to feel overly crowded. After a ful day/evening exploring the Strip (only 10 minutes away), the resort provided a restful haven to which to return for some peace and quiet. The staff was great about answering questions, recommending nearby restaurants (House Hash A-Go-Go at the M--WOW!), and providing extras as needed--like a day pass to the grounds after check out, so we could play poolside until our flight departed. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas vacation”
Reviews.Author: AnneDeee
Reviews.Content: We traded in our timeshare in Orlando to visit Las Vegas for the first time. Vegas was great. Pros: Property was attractive and clean. Pool was beautiful. Location of Cancun was only 10 minutes from strip (by car with no traffic.). Cons: We booked two units and requested that they be next to each other. I confirmed this three times. When we checked in the front desk confirmed that they were next to one another. When we got to our rooms they were down the hall from one another. We went back to the front desk and they told us there was nothing they could do. Priority is given to owners. The rooms were outdated and needed to be renovated. Kitchen in one bdrm and two bedrm are extremely small. The cleaning staff is extremely noisy in the morning. Every morning they woke us up with banging things around and loud chatter. We extended our stay for a day. These arrangements were made months in advance. When we checked in this was all confirmed. Regular stays are Friday to Friday. Come Friday morning we received 5 phone calls and a dozen knocks on the door asking us when we would be leaving. We finally had to speak to a manager to insist that the staff stop bothering us. Staff at the Cancun was less than friendly. Also the spa is not a full service spa. They only do facials and massages.

Reviews.Title: “Cancun Resort”
Reviews.Author: JohnandJamie
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, it remind us of going to Cancun Mexico. It was beautiful. Would reccomend it to any one going to vegas! We give it an "A" plus.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of cutbacks show through”
Reviews.Author: J0vie
Reviews.Content: Pros: nice pool area, comfortable beds, nice option to have 2 bdrm suites, humongous baths, spacious suites. Cons: no shuttle to strip (discontinued it in Fall 2011), pool closes way too early during Spring Break (6:30 pm), slides + 1 pool closed, constant problems with TV remote, decor old (tube tvs, not flat screen, dishwasher not the greatest, small kitchen etc). Considering all the cons, we would not stay here again. Tahiti Village, who is just down the road, has a shuttle and newer suites, plus pool that closes at 8pm. Was disappointed, this being a time-share resort.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: travelingrandma975
Reviews.Content: I am an owner in a timeshare, & went to this resort with 4 other friends for Spring break We are all school bus drivers in need of relaxation! We are all in our 50's & 60's & thought the resort was beautiful! The grounds were immaculate, the pools & waterslides great! We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath & it was roomy & very clean. Would be good for families-we cooked breakfast every morn. then went out for the day, came back & cooked dinner & went out again! There is a grocery store close & a bus stop a half block away. Would go again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: mfoegypt
Reviews.Content: Rooms are immaculate. Value is second to none. NOT an outdated hotel. Furniture and rooms are well cared for. Pool is great. 5 minute drive to the strip ( just take I-15 which parallels S Las Vegas Blvd then exit off back to the strip) Stayed for a week.

Reviews.Title: “OK place but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithkidd0s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for our spring break March 25-31. We'd give the resort a "D" rather than a "C" because for some ridiculous reason, the resort decided to close the only heated pool with the slides for maintenance for three days of our stay. Really? During spring break season? The staff was moderately accommodating (except for several cranky lifeguards) but not what we've experienced elsewhere. OVERALL - not enough to keep kids busy for a week. Just hanging at the pool gets old for preteen kids who don't want to participate in the organized activities. Preschoolers need a more shallow pool. Food on site is mediocre. No recycling. Too far to walk to most food/entertainment and cabs are expensive. Wifi isn't free. Probably better to trade time for mom & dad to get away here and take the family elsewhere. It was too chilly to be there in late March and expect to spend the week at the pool. The wind was also too strong to be poolside on a couple of days. One day the high was 52. Keep in mind the day's high temp may not be reached until mid-afternoon. We went to the fun dome at Circus Circus one colder day ($30 cab ride both ways) and took the kids to see the Bellagio fountain, etc. on the strip another day. ROOMS - one owner told us the two buildings closest to the lobby have bigger rooms. We had a first-floor room closest to the heated pool. Be advised - it's not the ground floor so there are still stairs, or the elevator in the other direction from the pool. The room was fine. Kitchen was small but contained everything we needed but could have used more than 6 serving pieces. Had to wash dishes every meal and ran out of diswasher soap twice. Baths have jet tubs. Beds were very comfortable and there are new TVs in bedrooms and living room. Lots of towels and pillows, fairly clean. Have to call for trash pickup, which you'll need daily with the small kitchen trash cans. Rooms are cleaned on Wednesdays if you're staying a week. FOOD - a real dissapointment. There are two restaurants, one open for breakfast and the other for lunch/dinner. Food was OK, not great. Sandwiches, salads, fried food (see menus in attached photos). We rolled in at noon on Sunday and after spending $60 for 2 adult and 2 kids meals + beverages, decided to find groceries fast! We didn't eat there again except for poolside nachos served with that gloppy ballpark cheese-like substance. NEARBY - Food 4 Less grocery is across the street (a busy 6-lane highway) but it has everything except great wines. Check the liquor stores nearby if you want that. There are a couple of fast food outlets in the same vicinity. Bootlegger Italian was really good, about a 1/2 mile north of the grocery store (we walked). Cane's Chicken is 1.5 miles and Southpoint casino is about 2 miles south of the resort ($10 cab ride). GENERAL RESORT AREA - Overall a lovely property surrounded by a not-so-lovely empty lot (the resort is expanding) and a motor home park. Just don't expect a view unless you face the strip to the north. There were four covered hammocks (under 14 not allowed, used it anyway). Plenty of pool chairs and cocktail tables when we went, nice lighting at night. Four hot tubs around the property for everyone plus an adult tub inside the pyramid. The resort in on the flight path for the airport so there is a lot of airline traffic (not directly overhead). It wasn't an issue since the pyramid waterfall masks the noise. Kind of fun to see the planes come and go. We made a game of "which airline will be next?" POOL - No outside food or beverages allowed. People still brought stuff and I didn't see anyone accosted for it. But no coolers, not even if you buy the drinks there. You have to cover up and put on shoes to visit the restaurant or the sundry shop (snacks + household basics). Best deal at the shop - large Arizona iced tea cans for $1. Expect to hear music from the vast speaker system all day. One float per room (the cheap foam type that barely supports a child) and you can't bring your own? You can BUY one for $11 at the sundry shop that you're allowed to use. The lifeguard actually checked at the shop to make sure we bought a raft and didn't bring our own. Sheesh. You are allowed circular floats for the kids. We also used our inflatable basketball hoop and squirt guns with no problem. The larger pool isn't heated (may be for the summer). The heated pool is 4 1/2 feet deep, way too deep for our preschooler. He played on the entry steps. The water slide is part of the same pool, separated by a rope. That side of the pool has the four water slides and is 3 1/2 feet deep. Whoever designed that got it backwards. My daughter thought the water slides were fun. All are tunnels, not partially open slides. KID'S CLUB - lots of movies to watch, games to play, crafts and some electronic toys. We played popcorn bingo ($3/card, min. 5 players) and the kids won prizes. There are indoor and outdoor organized activities about every hour during the day. Great staff! Thanks for doing this part right. ADULT LOUNGE - big screen TV, three pool tables (under 14 not allowed to play, did anyway), foosball and ping pong. Also chess tables, booths and a sofa area. Kids liked it. There is also a paid computer area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel19882012
Reviews.Content: The facility was clean and the staff friendly. However, this facility is best for a family. It was just my husband and me and I was quite disappointed. It is a long way from the strip and because there is no shuttle, you must have a rental car or you can spend a fortune in taxi fares. We had a one bedroom unit that had no hot water in the kitchen and it took a very long time for the hot water in the main bath to heat up. The shower nozzle was boken, so we had to use it as a hand held. We were there for five days, so there was no maide service. We did however request clean towels on the third day and got them. There is a very large outlet mall close by and lots of restaurants. We would not return as a couple but we did request to see the ppenthoue to determine if we woud take our family there. The penthouse is very nice and we may give it a second try but no time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice treat”
Reviews.Author: misscecily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and was so much nicer than getting a hotel room for 4 days. Only bad point (or good point , depends on how you look at it) is the key pass to get inside the hotel and the elevator. Nothing abnormal, but when one of the elevators broke, it did put a kink in some things. Literally seven minutes to Vegas strip and worth the money if you don't mind staying in a non flashing neon extravaganza. The two bedroom, 2 bath suite, had a single and two fulls plus the couch pulled out. Sleeps five comfortably. Kitchen was a bonus for those late night treats and the balcony had a great view of the pool, which by the wasy gorgeous. Hamocks throughout the pool area was a nice touch and was soo relaxing. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Left wanting”
Reviews.Author: fndlair
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare "resort" but I must say I was a little disappointed. We stayed for a week in a two bedroom suite. When we checked in the unit had a strong smell of curry. I still cant stomach the thought of eating Indian food because of the smell of that room. The unit was acceptable, barely comfortable. The beds were good, the chairs were awful, the TV's are old and barely working and the unit was not as clean as I would like. There also seems to be competition for parking. There is limited parking under the building and it seems that some residents are willing to get into confrontations over the spaces there which led to some uncomfortable situations. We travel with a service animal as well, they do not permit pets on the property and I was confronted by security with a Barney Fife attitude on a couple of occasions. If they were concerned about the status of our animal they could just call the front desk and ask if a service animal is registered in our unit. Face time with the rent a cops was not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Find in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: We needed to go to Las Vegas to visit friends, making location important. We haven't been in Las Vegas for years, and don't really gamble, so the whole casino thing wasn't important. Cancun Resort is just down from the strip and right off the freeway. Access was easy and there were no crowds to deal with. Check-in was a breeze-the staff being friendly and efficient. The big surprise was the "villa", a one bedroom/2 bath condo unit with a great view of the strip. The room was super clean and comfortable with a private veranda to relax on (or smoke if you do that). In addition, the room was quiet-something that seems to be hard to come by lately. The pool and spa areas were clean and spacious, and the grounds were well maintained. This place is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place and will return!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHockeymom
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Cancun Resort. We love it because it is perfect for families. We stayed two nights in February. The front desk was very accommodating when we wanted to switch rooms to be closer to our friends. Our only disappointment was that the pool closed very early and our kids didn't get a chance to swim because we were gone during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Spa”
Reviews.Author: Gildah
Reviews.Content: My birthday was 2/25/12 and some of my friend want to have a spa day the next. When we walk in the penthouse It was a two bedroom house. In one room a jacuzzi jet bath tub i mean big i know six can fix in that tub. The second room has a shower that bigger than my bathroom at house. the view was over looking the pool and let me not for get the jacuzzi on the patio.Next day spa O the spa the best feeling i love it 3 1/2 hour relaxation. going back for the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good warm weather off-Strip resort. Especially for families.”
Reviews.Author: efspetaluma
Reviews.Content: This is a large resort with two pools, water slides, five spas, many lounge chairs, a poolside café and even several outdoor hammocks. Unfortunately for us, the weather was nasty and the large pool, as well as several of the spas, was closed for the season. I think that if we had come in the summer and been able to enjoy the outdoor facilities this would be a totally different review. We phoned ahead and requested the best view available. We were given a two bedroom condo on the sixth floor of building five. It had a large patio (again, too cold to use) and a great view of the Strip in the distance with the mountains behind. We were able to find a parking spot in the underground garage about half the time, but the outside parking was also convenient. There are carts to help you get your things up the elevators and to your room, but they have to be hunted down during the popular check in and check out times. Our rooms were very clean and quiet. The master bed was way past its due date, with a large gully on one side. Two overhead lights were burned out and they remained burned out through our stay, despite repeated calls to get them fixed. The kitchen was the smallest “full” kitchen we have ever experienced in a condo. There were no serving platters or bowls. The living area was cramped with four adults and the furniture was uncomfortable. The wind whistled under our door even though we were way down the hall from the entrance. We finally blocked the bottom of the door with a towel. The drive to the Strip was not bad, especially when we took the side streets to our chosen locations. There was plenty of free parking in the casinos. We could have taken a cab, but the resort staff informed us that the one way charge was $ 25 and that was more than we wanted to pay. We took a day trip to the Red Rock area and that was well worth it. The Town Square Shopping Center just down the street is very attractive with a lot of good stores and restaurants. We especially enjoyed the Brio Tuscan Grill. We also got several meals at the Whole Foods Market and just brought them back to the condo rather than try to cook. We ate once at Steiners across the street from the resort, but the noise level was excessive and the food was not worth it. Pros: Great outdoor facilities – weather permitting. Quiet. Convenient to the freeway and the strip. Cons: A car is a necessity. Beds are old. Kitchen is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Customer service/reservations/front desk - all excellent. We chose to stay here because we wanted a place with a full kitchen. The price and location were great. Other options were $90-100 more per night and the location was not as good. We were in Las Vegas to hike, not to gamble. However, you could be at the Strip in just a few minutes (about 4 miles) - you could even catch a bus if you didn't want the hassle of driving up there. The pool and hot tubs seemed well-maintained, but it was chilly while we were there and did not use them. There was a grocery almost right across the street, and an outlet mall about a mile away. The carpet in the villa was worn and needed to be replaced. Everything else was fine - linens were all new. We were told that we had to go to the concierge to get our parking pass. After waiting in line (behind 1 person) for 20 minutes, we returned to the front desk and got our parking pass there.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Cancún Resort”
Reviews.Author: vtvalenz
Reviews.Content: Slightly off the Strip makes it for a quiet stay, ample free parking, very nice pool, jacuzzi and other amenities, easy access to freeway. I love being able to eat breakfast when I wake up (not limited to breakfast hours) because of the full kitchen in the suite. Very nice bathroom, with jacuzzi tub. This is part of our time-share, and came with lots of coupons, so we received a free Gondola ride (outside of Venetian Hotel), and a free dinner at one of the Venetian restaurants. Also, it is only about 5-7 minutes from the South Las Vegas Outlets and a grocery store is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was so awesome!”
Reviews.Author: haleybear
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. It was so clean, the bedroom bath was HUGE, the hotel didn't smell like cigarette smoke like all of the other hotels, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I also loved that it wasn't on the main part of the strip so it was nice and quiet all day long, and even though it wasn't exactly on the strip, the drive to it was really quick. Even though it was a smaller hotel compared to the others, it wasn't crowded, and we found parking every night in the underground garage. I'm not sure if we just didn't have neighbors or the walls were soundproof, but either way we didn't hear anybody the entire time. We baked cookies during our stay, and the recipe called for just one egg, and the chef let us have one instead of buying an entire carton!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Unit - Away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bensus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week before Christmas - our unit was nice - had two bathrooms - one bedroom with a king sized bed. The kitchen is very small but usable. It was cool when we were there so we didn't use the pool or the really big deck attached to the unit. It was fairly easy to get in and out of - our unit was in a building with the garage underneath - that was convenient when we could park in that underground area - and go directly to the elevators. There are no washing machines in the unit - they do have coin operated units on most floors (not the one we stayed on) - one washing machine and one dryer per floor - looks like there used to be two but one set was removed. The pool area has a lot of restricted rules posted - no eating outside food etc. and there is a bar and restaurant in the area. There were quite a few young people in the building we were in and we had to complain two nights about noise when we were awakened and had to put up with a lot of noise early in the evening on Saturday night. Not sure if we would stay again but it was pretty ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay..”
Reviews.Author: Coco57Noah
Reviews.Content: We stayed two bedroom with a view of the strip..both bathrooms had a jacuzzi tub..staff was very professional and helpful..Have recommended it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Jerry N
Reviews.Content: Spent Thanksgiving with family in St. George Ut. then back to Vegas with them to see our son perform at the Hardrock Cafe on the strip Saturday. Reserved a two bedroom suite for two nights. My cousin and her husband were very impressed with the accomodations. My wife and I had spent time here before and enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: Rick F
Reviews.Content: Had A great time visiting friends at the Sout Point casino. The Cancun resort was close and allowed us easy acess to where we needed to go. The resort was great. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: red1bull
Reviews.Content: Stayed at cancun resort las vegas and it was a great hotel for whole family, rooms where very nice pool rocked and just a great view from are room. Will be back there again as the rooms would be great for what ever the party size.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Ellen284
Reviews.Content: Had a relaxing and enjoyable time with the friendly staff. Rooms were clean, bright and beautiful. Enjoyed the 2 full baths with the jets. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Food was excellent and the bar/lounge was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Morty488
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the resort. It had all the comforts of home only not at home! It is very relaxing. If I had to choose my favorite area of the resort it would have to be the pool area. The water falls area is relaxing. There is just enough ambient noise so you do not have to hear everyone elses conversation. I would definately recommend the resort to anyone who asks about it!

Reviews.Title: “good job”
Reviews.Author: Ramon D
Reviews.Content: it feels good to arrive there, employees always have a smile on them and always willing to help out, i will say the only bad thing about the hotel is the parking,

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse Suite”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: Cancun is a 3 star resort but the Penthouse suite was very nice. If you are looking for the service and amenities of a 4-5 star resort or the traditional "Vegas experience", this is not the place for you. All we needed was a clean room and we did not mind driving to the strip. I have attached pictures from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “vegas fam. reunion”
Reviews.Author: juan u
Reviews.Content: since we usually stay at this hotel we take it from granted. Enjoy the location, options, staff, resort and the proximity to the action. Will continue to make this our place to stay every time we go to Vegas. Juan

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to this resort, but not my last.”
Reviews.Author: monet2u
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this location, it was a bit difficult to figure out the parking garages (of all things), but once I got to my room and settled in, all was good. The room was fantastic and for a one bdrm, very roomy. My bed was comfy and the soaking tub was a bonus. It would be nice if they offered free WiFi. Also, check in seemed rather slow for the time of evening I go there and not having a real line of guest waiting. Keep in mind this is pretty far out on the main strip LV Blvd., but there's a grocery store across the street so you can get some supplies while you're staying there. I also think they might offer a cheap shuttle down to the main part of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Cancun/Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Eileen I
Reviews.Content: Been staying at Cancun for years and LOVE the place. Grandchildren really enjoy the tube slides and the pool when were not at Lake Mead for the day since we bring out boat every summer.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Howard Y
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our suite very much, there was plenty of room. The view from the deck was absolutely beautifyl, unfortunately one of our group became ill and we had to cut the trip short. We will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Must Do”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: This was the most exciting trip I've experienced in years. Cancun Resort is located near the Airport and Rental Cars Agencies. The tour was the most interesting tour I've taking, the room were very well decorated, kitchen stocked with every utensils I could image. My friend took advantage of the gym, while I studied.

Reviews.Title: “A hop, skip & a jump from the strip, but far enough to enjoy peace during your downtime!”
Reviews.Author: oochiewallie35
Reviews.Content: We visited the Cancun Resort in the winter so the main pool was closed, however it was still beautiful to gaze upon. The Copa Cabana Cafe was open & we had a great view of the slide & smaller pool while we ate breakfast! The room was beautiful and was quite spacious! I loved the fact that it had a kitchenette and the fact that the bathtub was a hot tub! The bed was comfy. The only thing that I didn't like about the rooms was the decor, it could use an update, but it definitely wasn't terrible! I loved the balcony which looked out toward the strip... which was close enough to get to in a matter of a few minutes, but far enough away to have some peace and quiet during our downtime. The service was phenomenal! I spoke directly with a manager there while I was visiting the store and he was quite knowledgeable and helpful, but above all, was genuinely friendly. The housekeeping staff was always smiling and friendly. The gym facilities, aside from being beautiful, were constantly being cleaned during the 1 hour period that I was there which is of the utmost importance! The concierge was quite helpful as well!

Reviews.Title: “sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: Betty G
Reviews.Content: arrive about 9:30pm, went to bed about 1:00am bedding smell like vomit finally call housekeeping. they went to change the bedding. smell the odor, stop went got more bedding, padding even gloves mask and plastic bags for the gross smelling bedding, you couldn't see any stains but the smell was bad, 2nd unit we had was a hadicap for my mother nothing is handicapp accessable but the shower. The unit was so noisey, Maintance couldn't do anything to quite it down, that was for three nights They did address each situation. . THANHS

Reviews.Title: “Cancun/Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie E
Reviews.Content: Great place, been going for the last 10 years with family & friends!

Reviews.Title: “Kitchen + Water Slide = Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: MadameChocolate
Reviews.Content: We love the comfort of a Cancun apartment. Kids love the water and game room, parents love the hammocks and quiet rooms. Great location for exploring Vegas and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “July 2011 trip”
Reviews.Author: Dolores A
Reviews.Content: Always a very nice place to stay. Amenities are very good and location is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ebelloso
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very clean, very friendly staff. Great experience; most definitely will return. Very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: stacy p
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days on the weekend it was a great experience. Dont have much to complain about, the room was clean and comfortable. The kitchen is decent sized if I needed to cook. The fridge is great to have to have our drinks. I love that they have a sofa bed in the livinng room so its like we have two bedrooms in the one bedroom. The pool looks great too. I will definetly stay there again soon, not too far from the strip its just right.

Reviews.Title: “Accountant”
Reviews.Author: Julie60959
Reviews.Content: The Cancun is a beautiful hotel. It is clean and the bed are comfortable. The hotel is close to the strip and all the shops. The people are nice and welcome you. It is so quiet there and I don't feel like I'm in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Cancun Resort, LV”
Reviews.Author: Tnt-people
Reviews.Content: The Shuttle Bus service, though it is a good thing needs to be better co-ordinated to get passengers to and from the pick-up stops. Length of waiting time to be picked up from the strip is too long, especially late in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option .”
Reviews.Author: JuanFdez
Reviews.Content: Was a pleasure stay there.My family and I enjoyed all nice pools and restaurants. You can also cooks inside the suite, there is a modern kitchen. But you don't need a car to go play Casinos they also has an excellent buss transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Our Cancun Visit”
Reviews.Author: 3MyTA
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoy visiting Cancun each summer. It is very family oriented and it allows us to enjoy a relaxing and peaceful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: MariaElena G
Reviews.Content: Great price for quality of room. Not too far from the strip and no need to get lost!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY!!”
Reviews.Author: randy h
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and wonderful pool and landscaping. Hotel van transportation to & from town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times!”
Reviews.Author: Rosa P
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice. The second time around was even better. Lovely pool! My parents loved how comfortable it was. Close enough to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cancun for four nights. As always when there we have good service and enjoy our stay. We have stayed there multiple times and will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ben M”
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, reserved 3 room for all my married children & my children at home, everything was great

Reviews.Title: “Classy place”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany A
Reviews.Content: I have loved staying at the Cancun resort. When we stop in Las Vegas we always stay here. We're not huge gamblers so it's nice to have a place to stay that isn't so focused on gambling. The suites are really lovely too. We love it and although the kitchens aren't huge it is nice to be able to cook a few things or have breakfast items in the room rather than spending the money. There is even a grocery store basically across the street if you want to pick up groceries once you get there. The pool is fantastic too with some fun water slides and plenty of lifeguards to keep everyone safe and prevent anyone from ruining your fun too. And when you're ready to hit the strip you're close enough that it's super easy to get to. This definitely improves the feel of any Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “We had several problems.”
Reviews.Author: Timothy R
Reviews.Content: In the room we were in there were several problems. The sofa and big chair in the living room were very uncomfortable. In the kitchen a door knob came off in my hand. In the bed room the handle on one of the drawers was in the drawer. The air condioner had a rattle so load that we had to turn it off in order to sleep. The lights in the bathroom were so dim we called the front desk. When the sevice person arrived and checked to bulbs he said that the wrong bulbs were in the fixtures. We have stayed at the Concun Resort several times and have had problems in different rooms each time. We met with a manager to make some suggestions on how to over come some of these problems. He took our suggestions and gave us his phone number. He told us to call him before our next visit and also to call him if we had any more problems. We called him several times and he didn't answer the phone. We left messages at the front desk and the messages were never answered. We like Cancun Resort and have made many trips to Vegas on business. It is sade to see all the problems that we have had. We hope that others have not had the type of problems that we have had. I have been a Monarch Grand member for a long time and have enjoyed many stays at many of the resorts. This is the only one where we have had consistant problems.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming here since it was built and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. Housekeeping and maintenance promptly responsive whenever we need more towels or something repaired. The only reason I don't give this 5 stars is the cafe. We periodically try the cafe and have always been disappointed. The food is mediocre at best. Oh well, I guess we can't have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Who Needs The "Strip"!!”
Reviews.Author: MJames227
Reviews.Content: Really! Who needs the strip? The Cancun Resort is just that, a resort. We were there 4 days. We went to the strip one of those days, you know, just to "see what there was to see". Now, it was great and all, but quite doable in one day. The rest of the time, we enjoyed Cancun Resort. The rooms were FABULOUS! And with on site restaurants, gym, spa, mini grocery store, rec hall, etc, etc, etc, we didn't need to go anywhere else! The best part was the pool. Outside it was 90-100º. We spent our days, relaxing on the very comfortable lounges; then when we got too hot, we dipped in the pool and went back to our comfortable lounges. Nice! We're definitely going back; probably even yearly. So, really, who needs the strip??!!??!! (but it's nice that it's there, if you've never been)

Reviews.Title: “Cancun Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ding2012
Reviews.Content: After the first night we tried to get another room because the hide a bed was not comfortable and we eneded up sleeping on the floor, we tried to get aother room and they said no more vacant room. They charge us for one night we specifically asked if they will charge us the rest of the reservation and the answer was don't worry about it. When the bill came we were charged two more days that we did not stay there. So wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Cantal
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort but needs some updates and renovations. The pool area and grounds are nice and great for families with young and older children. The units are will equipped and the kitchen is a great addition. It is a little far from the action but a car makes it all right. The only problem with that is that in the evening if you want to go to the strip and have drinks and a show, you have to cab it home. One other down side is the internet as it is $9.95 per day and that is for one device and when you are travelling with a family each person has their own computer or ipad.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: HelenneA
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Cancun Resort in Las Vegas and each time has been a wonderful experience. I highly recommend this hotel/resort for those who love the summer sun, poolside fun and relaxation. Not to mention the Vegas night life just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: tony4307
Reviews.Content: It's always a good stay at this timeshare/all suite/hotel. Clean, out of the way property with very friendly and responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: adamski73
Reviews.Content: I really liked this resort. Some of the other exchanges I've made in Las Vegas are not nearly as nice as the resorts I could exchange for in other parts of the world. This place is an exception. I think it really is one of the nicer timeshare resorts. The only drawback is that it takes a short drive, bus, or taxi ride to get to the Strip. If this resort had a 24-hour shuttle, I'd stay there every time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maynardt
Reviews.Content: We belong to Monarch Grand Resorts. Cancun is one of there featured resorts. It is a very nice place to stay if you want to be out of the busy Downtown Vegas area. Very clean and beautiful villas. We only stayed 1 night coming back from Utah but wished we had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms. Good for couples and the family”
Reviews.Author: jme419
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Cancun Resort in Las Vegas. We bought into this timeshare mainly because we wanted to have an excuse to travel more with each other and as a family with our kids. We absolutely love the full kitchens they provide in all their resorts. They rooms are very nicely decorated and spacious. We like the idea on how the resort rooms as a whole make you feel at home and not just a cramped hotel room like most places are. We love the bathrooms with their huge jetted spa tubs as well. We didn't take advantage of the pool area this trip, but I know once we go back with the kids, we will use it.

Reviews.Title: “Alfadude”
Reviews.Author: alfadude
Reviews.Content: Great for a Vegas family getaway. The rooms are large and comfortable. Very good pool, and great for the family. They arranged babysitting for us too.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas without Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunman1999
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to do in Vegas but if you want to get away from the continuous parade of people then Cancun may be for you. The resort is on Las Vegas Blvd but a few miles from the action that never sleeps. I have stayed on the Strip and it is a "one time" thing for a family that we didn't want to do again. The resort is more subdued and has a great water feature, although it could use a bit more shade.

Reviews.Title: “Sin City New Years”
Reviews.Author: bucketofbolts
Reviews.Content: Very good and well maintained. I can not say enough good things about the staff, security, housekeeping. Considering the resort was full, everything was handled in a vey timely manner. Believe me, I am a extremely critical about services and will give a bad revue. But the Cancun was the exception to the rule. If there was a negative, it would be the lack of transportation to and from the strip. The place is extremely spacious, and the location of the resort. I will definitely stay here again, and wish all of Monarch resorts were equal if not better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Jorgs65”
Reviews.Author: annette j
Reviews.Content: We found the resort great. We have stayed here twice now. The rooms i thought were very luxurious and modern and included a full kitchen. There are a lot of amenities- you could visit and not step off the grounds. There is two pools, waterslides, a library and two different cafes/bars. It is off the strip a bit so is a bit quieter. There was only one downside and that there was no shuttle the second time we visited- my husband was a little disappointed with that. Overall if we were to visit Vegas again we would definately look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: advisiato
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here. It was nice after a long day (or night) to be able to head back to the room and not have to walk through a casino, see a slot machine, or inhale smoke just to go to sleep. Great for families, business trips, a romantic getaway, or just time with friends. Great pool, and friendly service. This hotel does not have all the "flash" that a strip hotel might have, but that's probably why I preferred to stay here. Also instead of only the single, small room with a bathroom, a bed, and a television, this resort offers all the comforts of home. Every time I go to Vegas, I'm checking for availability here first.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: araes2102
Reviews.Content: Friends own a timeshare with this company and used points to get two 2 bedroom suites, apartments really. Traveled as two couples, each taking one of the suites. They were really large, larger than my first apartment! Included two master suites, a full kitchen, HUGE jetted spa tub in one bathroom and a spa tub on the private patios, plus living and dining room areas. The decor was modern and pleasant. The whole place was very clean. Enjoyed the toiletries they put out and utilized the in-room safe. Ths place is off the strip by several miles, but rhe drive was only a few minutes and it was nice to get away. The grounds were beautiful; wish we could have enjoyed the pool, but it was quite chilly while we were there (much better than being too hot though!). The staff was attentive, even sent maintenance at 2am when the faucet in my friend's room broke (which was fixed promptly). Enjoyed this property and would love to bring the kiddos to enjoy the pool and waterslide!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place, also great place to stay for families with kids.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgirl1965
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a weekend out trip and we all loved it! The beds were comfortable, the room was decorated nice, the giant jet stream bathtub was amazing and we enjoyed having the full kitchen. We stayed 3 nights and 4 days so we were able to use the pool everyday and some of the other facilities. The pool was beautiful and the water slides were a blast. The resort is located on Las Vegas Blvd South, and it's an easy 3.5 mile drive from the heart of the Strip (away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip). We had a rental car, so going back and forth was no problem. The facility was quiet and clean, with plentiful and convenient parking. We are planning a trip back in 2012 and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice off strip property”
Reviews.Author: mick1036
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice off the strip property this is it. It is very quiet and a wonderful resort setting. The rooms are in several buildings centered around a large pool area with numerous palm trees, cafes, and other ammenities. It was a little cold when I was there, but in warmer weather it would be a wonderful place for adults or for kids to hang out during the day time. The room I had overlooked the pool with a small balcony with table and chairs. The room had a nice kitchen area, dinning room, sitting room, two bathrooms with very nice soaps and shampoos, two nice flat screens and a king size bedroom. Everything was quite lovely. If you're looking for a quiet place to relax and play...this is it. It would be perfect for families. The strip is only a couple miles down the road....you don't even have to make any turns. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Cancun Resort -- Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mcsgonzo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in other resorts in Vegas -- Cancun sounds fun but not even close to Cancun. What had us hooked was the pool -- but the rooms were not 5+ stars. If your looking for a great rooms -- this is not the place. As for the pool -- nice but the slide does close early :+(.... They do have happy hours -- but they do not offer shuttles to the strip (when we were staying there). The time we were staying at Cancun they were working on the roads -- so inconvenience (but not Cancun's fault) --- added time to get to the strip. We'll go back to staying on the strip....

Reviews.Title: “Home base away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: brianop
Reviews.Content: I think what initially attracted me to the Cancun Resort was the "villas," which have full kitchen facilities and are like self-contained mini-apartments. When on vacation, I like the option of being able to cook for myself if I get tired of "dining out" all the time. The Cancun Resort is a time-share property, but the management must treat a number of the villas more like hotel rooms, making them available for anyone who makes a reservation. The resort is located south of Las Vegas' airport, on Las Vegas Blvd South, an easy 3.5 mile drive from the heart of the Strip. I had a rental car, so going back and forth was no problem. It might be more difficult if one doesn't have access to a vehicle and is dependent upon public transportation. The facility was quiet and clean, with daily maid service for the villas. Parking was plentiful and convenient, either in the parking garage located on the lower level of each building in the complex, or alongside (behind) the various buildings. The small kitchen came well-stocked with the basics of dishes, cutlery, pots and pans, and small appliances, as well as a full-sized fridge, gas oven/range, and microwave. I really enjoyed being able to return to the quiet of the Cancun Resort, a bit of a distance from the hustle and bustle and crowds of the Strip. Each villa actually has 2 bathrooms: a smaller one -shower, toilet, sink -- located off the sitting room which has a sofa bed, and a very spacious bathroom off the bedroom with a double vanity and a jacuzzi tub/shower. I found the mattress on the bed to be a little soft for my liking, but not uncomfortable by any means. Each villa also has a spacious balcony with 2 chairs and a small table on it. I did not take advantage of the concierge services on premise while I was there, but the staff is more than willing to help their guests arrange show tickets, reservations, excursions, etc. I did use the Day Spa facilities one time during my stay and was very pleased with the therapeutic treatment I received there.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises, good or bad”
Reviews.Author: Saluki100
Reviews.Content: Cancun resort is a very average facility that serves a purpose but isn't anything extraordinary. Sometimes that is all that is needed. The location is off strip, access is good, parking is good, rooms are adequate, furniture other than beds is horrible, kitchen is very tiny yet functional, bathrooms are large, water pressure was amazing, rooms were mostly quiet, tv's are old and blurry, kitchen lacked some utensils making it difficult to make certain dishes, good patio, but bad patio furniture. Staff was friendly enough, swimming pool is great, on premises dining is mediocre. There was a small attempt to get us to participate in time-share buying but nothing serious and it was expected.

Reviews.Title: “No more shuttle????”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: That is really disappointing news....it's actually a deal breaker for me. The free shuttle made staying so far from the Strip a little more convenient. Especially since I can stay at Tahiti Village for cheaper, with a free shuttle and they are slightly closer to the Strip. I know times are tough but getting rid of the shuttle was a big mistake in my opinion. I hope this will change as I don't like renting a car with all the walking I do on the Strip. Otherwise, the pool at Cancun is very nice and the rooms, a bit small but nice enough. The full kitchens are a bit on the small size.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would definately recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: KimbersMc
Reviews.Content: Our party of 8 (5 adults & 3 children) stayed here for 2 weeks. 2 adults & 3 children stayed in a 2 bedroomed villa and myself, husband & 19 year old son stayed in a 1 bedroomed villa. The first thing we noticed upon entering was how clean it smelt. My son had a double sofa bed and his own bathroom in the living room area which also had a wooden screen he could pull across for privacy. The villa itself was very spacious and comfortable. The queen bed in our room was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in!! The ensuite was very spacious with lots of storage and the bedroom had lots of drawers as well as a wardrobe. The rooms were cleaned every day, towels changed, bins emptied, soaps etc replenished and the dishwasher even filled and put on if I forgot! The sofa bed was also pulled out, made and put back daily! We had a toilet blockage one day which was unblocked within half an hour by a member of staff and the sofa bed was locked in the out position another day which was assessed and replaced straight away with a brand new one. The staff were polite, helpful and courteous from the start. The pool area was spotless with plenty of sunbeds and clean towels and lilos (rafts!). The pool and jacuzzis were open as long as there was a lifeguard on duty until 10pm and the slides were great. The rest of our family in the 2 bedroomed villa could not fault it either and we will stay here again on our next visit without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience”
Reviews.Author: MM1909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks in October. The apartment was generally on the small side - particularly the kitchen but acceptable. The balcony is quite large but they could improve the practicallity of it, by making better furniture available - it is currently wasted space as you cant really use it. The apartments are quite dark and would benefit from lighter furniture - I think they are remodelling some of the apartments so perhaps this is part of the plan. The air-conditioning was effective but extremely noisy - the whole apartment shook - so much that the lightfitting shattered! The pool area is good (pool is not heated) and slides etc for kids - the music a bit too loud at times - but maybe we are just getting old! The transport to the strip was ad-hoc, when we arrived there was transport to the strip for a fee but then it stopped again. We did use it, but we had one occasion when it let us down - but I think it is better to provide some transport as taxis are expensive. We also used the local bus service which is cheap enough, but again not awfully reliable. I would say the hotel has cut costs - which is understandable in the current climate, but it was noticeable. The first thing we noticed was there is nobody to help with luggage - not a problem if they had automatic doors - but they dont. It was a long way to haul your luggage without any assistance. Also the conceirge staff seemed very inexperienced and had no local knowledge - which is obviously quite important. They can book trips etc - but added nothing to the process. There is no free wi-fi, but you can just walk across the road to Starbucks for this, or also the restaurant (Steiners) also just across the road. I would say they hotel are missing a trick here, because guests were going to the facilities over the road and spending money, whereas if their was free wi-fi on the resort, they would have probably spent more money there. We found the restaurants to be poor - the service rather than the food. We only had breakfast and dinner there once - that was enough. Again, I think this is maybe where they have cut costs. It was adequate - but no more than that. The resort was very clean and tidy and the grounds well maintained. I think if we went to Las Vegas again, we would stay nearer the strip - this is just too far out without free transport.

Reviews.Title: “great pool, far from the LV strip”
Reviews.Author: hsmomcharlottenc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2011. The apartment like suites were well designed with kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom, and two bathrooms. The space was great. There are planned activities and restaurants as well as the required gambling, but the casino is separated and not visible. The pool was wonderful--huge, nice, and had water slides (open only during the day). The number of life guards was laughable, and the pool is very dark at night. Since most places don't have life guards, I'm not sure why they even had one unless it is required in LV. The location is great if you are just flying in or out like we were, but not if you want to spend you time on the strip. It is not walkable and the shuttle service available only certain days of the week was $6 per person each way. Overall, this was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Close but yet Far”
Reviews.Author: chundell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2011 for a few nights. The pool area is on point with the water slides, grotto style hot tub, and hammocks. The resort discontinued the shuttle to the strip but as of Oct 9 i hear they have shuttle service to the strip for a fee. The location is not walking distance to the strip but has a few restaurants and grocery store and starbucks across the street from it. If your room is facing the strip you get a wonderful view of all the lights at night. I rented a car and there was ample parking but not much covered parking. The room (1 br villa) was comfortable and kitchen was ample. Cleaning of the rooms isnt daily unless you pay extra but towel service is daily as requested. The balconies are huge and have 2 chairs and a table to enjoy your morning in room coffee. All in all i have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Tappers1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 4 days and it was 4 days of luxury. It was a mini apartment with a kitchen/diner, lounge, bedroom and two bathrooms. The rooms were very clean and a good size for the two of us. The balcony was big too. The service we received was exceptional and all staff were very helpful and polite. The pool area was nice and quiet and contained a large pool with some slides (separate to the main part if the pool), several hot tubs, a waterfall, hammocks and free towels. The only downside to the hotel is that it isn't walking distance from the main buzz of las Vegas. A taxi onto the strip cost around $15-20 one way. So if you are looking for a few nights of fun but with the luxury of peace and quiet during the day and at bedtime-this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hammocks by the hottub”
Reviews.Author: Talanesea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and would again. This review is for my most recent visit in October 2011. The room was getting a little worn, the coffee maker was broken, some of the furniture was showing wear and tear. Still, it was clean and comfortable. We had a two bedroom suite. It had two bathrooms with jetted tubs in both. Our balcony overlooked the parking lot, but we didn't spend much time out there. The beds were great, but the pillows were so huge that sleeping with one meant having your neck bent and your head all awkward. It was just weird. The swimming pool has some little alcoves with hot tubs and hammocks. It was great to hang out there while drinking cocktails from the pool side bar. We also ordered food from there which was adequate for the time. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the resort- spacious- classy”
Reviews.Author: mary w
Reviews.Content: beautiful resort with beautiful pool and nice rooms....amenities nice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the Concierge,, Do not buy tickets for shows there”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: Hello Fellow Travellers This was our second trip to the Grand Monarch Cancun. It is a very nice Hotel although quite far from the strip, so you will definitely need a Rental. Our big complaint is with the Concierge Desk who sold us "TICKETS" for 2 shows (Chris Angel & Cirque do Soleil Elvis themed) that they charged us $71 per person and which we came to find out, first of all,when we arrived at both shows,, the box offices on location only charge $55 and secondly (and most importantly) that these so called TICKETS the hotel sold us were actualy only "vouchers" that had to be traded in for actual tickets once you reached the show. We were led to believe that these so called tickets would have us bypass the box office. WRONG,,, not only did we have to get in line at the box office to trade in the vouchers purchased at the Concierge at Grand Monarch Cancun but then when we reached the box office after standing in line for 1/2 an hour then we were informed my husband (the purchaser) had to have picture ID ti do the trade. Needless to say he left his ID in the car, not knowing he required it, he had to get the Valet to retrieve the car to get the ID. We had 6 in our group (including both our mothers over the age of 70). After all this chaos we missed half the show and the Concierge Manager (Mark Curry) would not (and said he could not,, do anything for us!!) Nothing,, can you imagine,, No wonder they say What happens in Vedgas stays in Vegas,,,, they rip you off. I've sent a complaint to his manager,, stay tuned, I'll let you know what comes of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're bringing the kids.”
Reviews.Author: Momthetravelagent
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel/condo. Nice accommodation, it's always good to have some cooking facilities and separate bedroom when you bring the kids. The pool and slide were awesome. Nice to be away, but not too far from the strip. (3 miles). Restaurants were just okay. Good discount shopping close by. It would be helpful to have a car, but not necessary as they have a good shuttle service to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2806
Reviews.Content: Place was okay. Room was clean pool was really nice. Rooms are small though. Wish they still had shuttle service to strip! Very aggravating spending alot of time on bus or alot of money on taxi. Spa was very enjoyable. Gym was very tiny. Wish bar area was open later than 10pm! good place for family that doesn't mind being away from the action. There are stores across the street

Reviews.Title: “Great Off-strip family resort”
Reviews.Author: DenverMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Cancun resort this past June with my mom and two kids in a one bedroom and we had a great time. We booked it as a "getaway" week on Interval International for a really inexpensive weekly rate. The one-bedroom is smaller than many units in comparable resorts (yet larger than the lock-off's in other timeshares). It was nice, however, because it had a moving partition that could give privacy to people who were staying on the sleeper sofa. The pool was really nice because it was so huge, and because of it's design, even when it was totally packed, it didn't feel crowded. They also had a live steel drum, calypso band that gave a great atmosphere to the pool area. There are four water slides but because they are made of an opaque plastic, they are pitch black inside so my kids were too scared to ride on them!! All-in-all, we had a great vacation and I would return. I have also stayed in Tahiti Village and I would say that they are comparable resorts, although TV probably ranks a little higher, being closer to the strip and having slightly nicer accommodations. Tahiti Village has nicer pools but the Cancun's pools don't feel as crowded. The Cancun one BR unit is nicer than the lock-off at Tahitti Village but if I had the opportunity to get the larger side one-bedroom, or the two-bedroom I would rather stay there than at the Cancun. Hope this helps you choose a timeshare!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Waxdoll68
Reviews.Content: I read several other reviews about this property before I booked my reservation. I had mixed feelings based on the reviews that I read. However, I want to say that the resort was better than I expected. It is located on Las Vegas Blvd. but approximately 5 miles down the road from the main attractions; but this is a good thing, because you have easy access to everything, but no crowds. The resort itself is lovely and the room was great. A number of people talked about how outdated their rooms were, maybe I was in one of the rooms that they have refurbished because it was very nicely appointed with everything that you could possibly need during your stay. Also in the master bathroom was the jacuzzi tub, which is the reason I booked the reservation in the first place; it worked well with no problems. The grounds were immaculate, everything was well maintained. The only small complaint that I could offer, there are times at the front desk when there is quite a wait. Even when you see other employees behind the desk who seem to be coming and going, without trying to help the guests standing in line. The lady at the front desk apologized for the delays and explained that the other employees actually were on breaks, lunches or ending their shifts. They need better coordination for more coverage, but overall a really great resort. I would definitely recommend this resort to others, as well as staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of like a mini apartment”
Reviews.Author: BamBam637
Reviews.Content: I was here on vacay in March 2011 for Las Vegas trip again. This typical hotel is not the fancy upscale type of hotel like the ones on the strip of Las Vegas. It is a decent and quiet place where you can get a good night sleep. We had stayed here through my bf's work for free but they still charge $20 something total for 3nights for service charge. Location: this hotel was off the strip 10-15min from the Las Vegas (locally). It's near the Las Vegas Premium outlet which is down the street 5min away. Plenty of familiar restaurants are near this hotel: chipotle, panda express, chili's, outback, del-taco, food 4 less store. Appearance: By the look of this resort, I think its a little bit outdated and old. The settings is like an Aztec/Mayan type of decor. The elevator is very old looking with carpet on the wall, weird but yea carpet on the wall. Room: I believe every room has their own mini kitchen which includes: a stove, microwave, sink, plates/utensils, fridge, coffee maker, and dining tables and chairs. Pretty much like your home kitchen room. I thought that was pretty interesting in case you want to make food in your own room. Not many hotels have this inside their own room. They have a small living room for you to watch tv outside of your bedroom. The sofa is pretty old looking too. Cancun needs to be renovated for new furtnitures & decor, seriously! BEDROOM: The bed here was nice and comfy. I don't know why every hotel always put some sort of sheet/thin blanket across the end of the bed, probably for decoration. We just like to use it on the floor for walking. T.v. was the old pop out television back in the days, but who cares about tv when you're in vegas, right? BATHROOM: The bathroom has 2 sinks, a toilet, and big bathtub where you can use it like a jacuzi. Plenty of towels in the restroom which was good. I always use those extra one for the floor becaus the floor can be cold sometimes if you walk barefoot. The bathroom was nice and clean. They gave you free tiny bottles of shampoo, lotion, and bar soap. I brought my own shampoo & soap always, including an antibacterial one. I think all hotels should have anti-bacterial hand soaps but I haven't seen them yet. Bring your own just in case you need them. -PARKING: At night this parking can be pack and you'll have to drive around the hotel for extra parking. You just have to walk a little farther to your room. -The door can really be very noisy when closing it, which is something I find kind of annoying. We don't want to disturb other neighbors yet we don't want the noise to disturb us either. -They do have a pool, ice machine, & laundry room. -This place does have ac and heater which was good for hot/cold weather. -They had their own bus to take you to the strip (free) I gave this place a 4 because it was clean and comfortable to sleep and showered in. Mostly when we travel those are the 2 main things that we needed first. The decoration/appearance was yes outdated but it didn't really bother me. I like how there was a full mini kitchen (not many hotel have this). Service was friendly. Location was not bad too.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Colleen928
Reviews.Content: I left Cancun Resort today after spending 7 nights there with 4 children. The pool area was well kept and was loaded with children. This is definitely a resort that caters to family vacations. We had a car and did not incur the cost of car rental or taxis to get to the strip. If coming to Vegas to party and go clubbing, i would prefer a hotel on the strip. Housekeeping is a little slow to respond. We found grocery stores across the street and another passed Blue Diamond beyond the freeway. The resort does need a little sprucing up. Furniture looked old and I noticed small tears in both the seats and the cushions in the lobby. This is the first area guests see and it gave the impression that upkeep at the resort is not a priority. I am an owner here and my last Monarch stay was Cabo Azul. This resort paled in comparison. Bedding was comfortable and I did enjoy the oversized jetted tub. Overall, our stay was OK. Not sure I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Won't Go Back”
Reviews.Author: mgjim6
Reviews.Content: First, the staff was friendly and helpful. The two bedroom unit was very clean. The kitchen was big enough, but the living room was small. There is no way this could sleep six unless two were very small children. There are no bellmen. There are no shuttles. The cab fare is expensive to the strip. There is a bus stop across the street. There are two pools - both crowded with children. The adults only hot tub was also filled with kids. This is a family resort. Don't go to relax by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Oriented Resort, poor transportation services”
Reviews.Author: Mpie27
Reviews.Content: The pool and poolside area was my favorite part of the resort. I would recommend it for families and older couples since it is nice and low key. My only complaint was that there was no shuttle service to the main strip. Since I was with a party of 5, there were not many cabs that take more than 4 people. The hotel staff was not helpful in that they would call you a cab and would make no effort to follow up. We have waited outside for cabs for over half an hour, at which point we decided to call a cab ourselves. The cleaning services were terrific and provided anything we asked for in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like it....I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aclozer
Reviews.Content: We love returning to this oasis in the desert. The rooms are well appointed and the staff is very friendly. The highlight for us though was the pool. It is HUGE. What is even more cool is that they have four water slides. Our son did not want to leave. He spent the remaining hours of our last day going down it over and over again. As we were leaving he could only ask, "when are we coming back?"

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort tho not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Yolande0061
Reviews.Content: The rooms and pool area are nice but they no longer shuttle to the strip. Good for families, kids activities

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: suepurdie
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed for a week in May. Lovely hotel. Spacious rooms with plenty of amenities. Had a fantastic view of the strip from our balcony. Definitely worth trying to get a room on the city side of the hotel. Pool was lovely and food was great. About 20 dollars in a cab to the strip but nice to be slightly out of town with plenty of shops nearby. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Has Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Mystelody
Reviews.Content: Pros: This place is great for accommodating a group of people (more than 2) and works out really cheap since a family can make their own breakfast. It's away from the strip which worked for me since that meant I could leave the gambling, smoke and noise behind and get a good night's sleep. Cons: The AC was noisy. One of the wash cloths was dirty with blood? Ketchup? I didn't want to know what exactly it was. Room service takes forever to show up (we needed additional supplies). Overall, the resort itself looks really good, especially on the outside. If only they would step up their cleanliness and service as far as the rooms go....

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay - too many kids”
Reviews.Author: pjccpa_ne
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas with two other couples and stayed at the Cancun Resort. One of the couples had a timeshare and this was the resort they could book so all three couples stayed here. The Resort itself is not bad. It is nothing fancy, but the pool is nice and the rooms are spacious. The beds were very comfortable. We had two complaints: first this place is about 4 miles south of the south end of the Strip so you need to Taxi everywhere and it is not easy to get a taxi (also you can only put 5 in a taxi so we always needed 2), and second was the number of kids. If you are looking for a family resort at a reasonable price in Vegas, then this place is not bad. If you are looking for adult time, then I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Bdev1
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort several times and it has served our purposes well each time with some minor inconveniences. The grounds and landscaping are in great condition. The rooms are nicely furnished and well maintained. I would suggest upgrades to the tv's... I don't think you could even purchase a tv that old in the bedroom. Flatscreen tv's would be much better and save space. Kitchens are small but well stocked and serve the purpose. (Food 4 Less is across the street) If you want a large kitchen and dining room, buy a vacation house, don't rent a condo. The staff were not the nicest people and could use some more training on friendliness. The nicest people are the room attendants (and the sales people of course). The pools are the best part of the resort. The kids never wanted to leave the pools and great waterslides. Unlike the other resorts, it stays open til 10pm, instead of closing at 5pm to try to force you to get in the casinos and gamble. Lounge with ping pong, pool etc. was good as well as the small arcade. Some people have complained about the location of the resort which is 2 or 3 miles south of the action on the strip. People need to research better before booking. That is the whole point of this resort. It is a family oriented resort just far away enough from the action that your kids don't have to see stripper brochures all over the ground when you walk outside, but it's close enough to drive to in less then 5 minutes if you want to be in the middle of the action. We enjoy going to the casino resorts, but also being able to leave it all to a quiet relaxing room. Breakfast (pancakes!) is very good and not too expensive from the restaurant. I am an owner so it doesn't cost me very much at all to stay here so it's very worth it to us. If you are going to spend a couple hundred a night and want to be submerged in all the nonstop action right outside your room door, this is not the place for you. If you're traveling with family or just want the best of both worlds in terms of relaxation and being close to the action but not in it, you will be happy with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, lots of fun.”
Reviews.Author: mcm65_11
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for a week and really enjoyed it. After reading reviews here I had myself expecting a dump but was surprised to find such a lovely resort. Our 1 bedroom unit was very clean and nicely furnished and the master bed was super comfortable. We stayed here with our four kids and their was plenty of space, you could even block off the living room with a screen so it was like a separate bedroom. The pool and water slides are great, my kids didn't want to come home! We had no problems with checking in or parking,

Reviews.Title: “I have mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: eddiesnickers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, I am actually an owner, but the staff needs more customer service skills. Really the only friendly people were the ones that could not speak english. I was disappointed with staff and hostess Marla who seemed concerned but actually never responded to my email. All it seems is the are trying to upsell you. Not happy but kids to enjoy slide. Plus they had no shuttle service . You are better just staying in any local hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mom2my4
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to spend the night in this resort on our way home from a family trip. However, by the time we (me, hubby, and kids ages 9,6, and 2 year old twins) arrived @ almost 9pm we were all very tired and just wanted to sleep. We had been traveling for 11+ hours. Check in was a hassle, they couldn't find the reservation, said it was my fault for booking throughe expedia and not calling first. It was 45 minutes before we got into our room. (and we couldn't find a luggage cart so we had to haul everything up piece by piece). The room was spacious and clean, the property seemed decent but there were more hassles at check out the next morning when the computer went down. When we got home they had ended up charging me on top of the expedia cost. All in all, the place was nice but everything was a huge hassle-not fun when you are traveling with kids. If I was staying for a few days and had time and patience to deal with stuff I might stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but.....”
Reviews.Author: DulcineaWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Location and Property The pool area is very attractive with a pyramid style central theme. Inside the pyramid are water slides which provide lots of fun and challenge for children and the 'young-at-heart' . The beautiful waterfall they advertise so heavily was unfortunately not turned on during our stay. The resort is rectangle-shaped with 2 condo buildings each on either side of pool. The main entrance and lobby are in front and offer nothing to write home about in the way of appearance but check-in was reasonable. This resort sits approximately 3 miles south of Mandalay Bay and 2 miles south of Town Square. There's a Food-4-Less, a CVS and some restaurants across the street which you can access on foot. There's no free shuttle to the "Strip", however, so you'll need to pay $9 each way or take a very expensive taxi. You are much better off renting a car on Priceline. Parking and Security Outdoor parking spaces are plentiful and there is a ground-level garage beneath each building. Valet units are readily available for guests to use to move luggage and other items in and out of buildings. The only way to enter the buildings, however, is through the parking garage at the ground level or through the secured gates and up a ramp (no stairway) to Level 1. There is no ground level entry other than the parking garage. If you are unable to secure a space in the garage and must park on the exterior you need to march down the ramp right along with the cars and trucks and make your way to the entrance. Having no pedestrian walkway makes this a very dangerous resort for children. Perhaps this is the reason for the propensity of very harsh speed bumps throughout the resort. You will need your key card to enter anywhere but the main lobby so don’t leave home without it. Security is a big deal here. Accommodations We stayed in a 2-bedroom condo in the Tulum building. The furniture is very outdated and fairly beaten up. This miniscule condo had an overall appearance of being cheaply thrown together. The provisions were sparse particularly in the kitchen which is nothing more than a tiny nook. The carpeting is cheaply laid and heavily stained. The rooms are all much smaller than other timeshares we've frequented. The teensy kitchen is very poorly equipped and there are no drawers. The silverware is kept in a holder inside a cabinet and the cookware and utensils provided are sparse and just don't make sense. For example, there is a steak knife set but no good way to prepare steak. Don't plan on cutting up fruits or vegetables because there is no appropriate knife for this. You get a very cheap serrated knife and that's it. There are a few tabletop appliances: blender, toaster, and coffeemaker. Major appliances include a stove, microwave, small dishwasher and a refrigerator which is small and very flimsy (no icemaker) but it works. We were provided with two ice cube trays but no bin. There is one ice machine on each floor but isn't of any use if it's not working. There is also one washer and dryer on each floor for which you will need quarters. If you don't have enough you'll have to go out to the restaurant and ask for change, as there are no change machines available anywhere. The balcony is decent but sparsely furnished. We had to call for an additional 2 chairs to accommodate our party of four. My overall reaction to these condos is that they are pulled together cheaply and haphazardly.
