Amenities It's a shame that so many things just don't work here. I needed to call for help with the washer because the coin slot was stuck. The dryer was also difficult. We couldn't run the microwave and the Jacuzzi simultaneously without blowing a fuse, another maintenance call. The staff put out a mass voicemail on movie night to let everyone it was cancelled due to "technical difficulties". The main pool was closed because the pool heater was in disrepair. They finally had to open it midweek because so many people complained. I think they trucked the water in from the North Pole though. By the end of our week the water finally warmed up enough for adults to use the pool. The restaurant was closed so they were running food orders to the bar at the pool. Children are not permitted inside the bar of course so families had to eat outdoors whether they wanted to or not. The waterslides are really lots of fun for both kids and adults and at least those were open for business! If you could negotiate the freezing water temperature, that is. The facility that functioned the best I thought was the gym. It was equipped with more cardio equipment than most timeshare gyms I've used and all of the equipment actually did work. A property this size should have more than just one small gym, however. Last but by no means least a "computer error" randomly checked us out midweek and our room keys all suddenly stopped working at once. Although it was a serious inconvenience at least it didn't occur at 2am. Many of the resort workers are very lovely people and greet you warmly but these are mainly housekeepers and maintenance folk. The timeshare staff absolutely does not do any extra miles for you here even if you're an owner. I understand that the economy is bad and the "unwealthly" have more important things to spend their scarce money on than midrange timeshares like Grand Monarch, but timeshare staff needs a lesson in understanding the service industry. Many of the clients at Grand Monarch are paying guests, not freebies on a tour. We're entitled to good service and smiling faces during our stay and if things continually go wrong there should be an acknowledgement. My family will not be returning to this timeshare and I just can't recommend it to anyone when there are much nicer timeshares in Vegas for essentially the same price. If you're already stuck with your reservation and can't cancel I wish you the very best. Perhaps the company will wake up realize that the season has indeed begun and they need to get with the program.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Gransm
Reviews.Content: Location was good approx 3.5 miles from strip easy drive straight down Las Vegas Blvd. Pools were nice, rarely crowded, water slides were fun. Beds were super comfortable. Quiet location. All employees were pleasant and helpful. Never had to wait for elevator. Found chips under chair and the shower had some mold in grout lines. Toaster didn't work. Would of been nice to have free access to a computer as I don't travel with a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Location SUCKS!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Doll57
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and the beds were very comfy. The decor is very old and outdated. The resort is also TOO FAR FROM THE STRIP!!! I spent a lot of money in cab fare and bus passes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Grounds”
Reviews.Author: newdink
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here for our 20th anniversary and are glad we did. This resort is exactly what you see in the photos. We were happy to find out that the pools were heated even in winter and the lounge had good food and drinks. It was perfect for us because we had our own car and could get to and from the strip easily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room for a family or couple.”
Reviews.Author: Olive_Pony
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was only a few minutes drive from the Strip, but the location allowed for cheaper rates. Inside even the one bedroom rooms, there was a small living room with a sofa bed and room divider, 1 1/2 baths, a small kitchen and dining table, a bedroom (with VERY comfy bed and linens), a private balcony, and a spa tub in the master bathroom. The resort was across the street from a Food 4 Less, which was great because we were able to stock up our kitchen when we arrived and cook some meals in-room. The bathrooms, bedroom and kitchen was very clean and the rates were affordable. It was really all we needed for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good family stop on way to Zion, etc.”
Reviews.Author: PL0967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight on the way to Zion, Bryce, Grand Canyon. I was just looking for a place where our kids (8 and 10) could have a big pool for the afternoon. It suited us just fine. The staff was helpful, although they try to sell you on various dining and recreation activities. No problem with that, just say no thanks. The pool is big and the water slides are really fun for the kids. We hate the strip and my wife likes to cook - I walked over to some big Food4less or such a ways down the street and we got groceries, had dinner in the room and life was good. The rooms are OK and clean enough, good value for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bland. OK if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: GenuinelyCurious
Reviews.Content: There's nothing really notable about Cancun. It's a major time share condo type arrangement. It's ok. I was with family and the extra activity of getting in and out of the car to get up to the strip undermined some of the value of having a large room. Food options are limited (again, without a car) and the shuttle is very infrequent and parking is a bit tight so even with a car, it's not a great option. I wouldn't stay there again except if it was with a larger group and price was imnportant.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable like home”
Reviews.Author: MakotoNet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and I felt like being at home. This place has very confortable rooms and you have everything you need to live like home... I would say better than home :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action without being in the middle of it”
Reviews.Author: travlinclan
Reviews.Content: touroghly enjoyed the stay at this resort. We had a getaway certivcate from a vacation ownership organization and were flexible as to where we wanted to stay so this worked out well for us. It was well off the strip (4.5 miles South of Madalay Bay) so is not convenient if you do not have transportation (we had a rental car) but they do have a shuttle service to New York New York on a farily regualr basis. We opted to use the shuttle once, and it worked out ok. We had no trouble with any staff the entire stay. We checked in late (we had requested it) with no problem although we heard from others that the lines coule be long during peak times. The staff was freindly and accomodaing with every request we made. We had a minor maintenance issue that was fixed in less than 30 minutes, and housekeeping was very responsive to any request for extras. Being that this is a vacation club resort, there is no daily housekeeping, but that wasn't a big issue for us. The pool are was clean and well maintained and all the staff in the area were easygoing and friendly to deal with. The fact that it was a slat water pool was an unexpected bonus (no heavy chlorine smell and easy on the eyes). The room was spacious (1 BR suite) with a compact but functional kitchen. The shower in the master suite was functional, but was part of a 2 person whilrpool tub so not an issue. There is a second full bathroom off the living room that had a good shower in it so no real problem there. We opted for a quiet view, so were overlooking the pool and out into the mountains. Very little noise from that viewpoint as we could not hear traffic on Las Vega blvd and only the occasional emergency vehicle. I don't think I would opt for the street side view, but that would be a personal choice. The only negative thing I could possibly mention and it was not a big deal was eating in club (we did not use the restaurant - same food just wanted to be by the pool). The food was good and the price not bad (slush drinks were a little pricy) the problem is they bring the food in styrofaom take-out containers and since we were "eating in" we found that a little strange" It was quiet while we were there until the weekend, but even then it was not bad while we were at the resort. During the week, there were no crwods anywhere, but during school breaks and high seasons, i can imagine that it would be different. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay and would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Out Dated, Run Down, Bland Rooms and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Lessand
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know where to begin. We specifically reserved a bedroom with a king-sized bed 4 months prior to arrival only to be given a unit with twin beds The desk clerk explained that the king-sized bedrooms were already taken by prior guests and that Cancun Resort reserved the right to change reserved rooms if made by time-share guests (we have a time-share with Interval International). The kitchen was so small that only one person could occupy it. Our 2nd floor balconey with its crumbling concrete floor gave us a up close and personal view of the parking lot. Color scheme was varying shades of beige and brown and the small living room that would seat 3 people or less sported cheap, Naugahyde vinyl furniture. The pool was lovely, but the adult-only jacuzzi was constantly occupied by children. Not a great place for couples without kids. We found Cancun Resort's units to be cheap, plastic, over-priced and disappointing, not at all like any place we've stayed with Interval International. We wished we could have known better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: In the past, when I have stayed at timeshares, I have found that the photographs on the site were old and the place had seen better days. This place was exactly the way it looks on it's website. I expected that since this place is located 3 miles south of the Welcome to Las Vegas sign, I would find it too far away. It wasn't at all. The trick is to skip driving up and down the Strip each time you travel. After leaving the resort, head North on Las Vegas Blvd, and take a LEFT onto Blue Diamond Rd. Hop on I-15 and that will take you to any location you need to go on the Strip, avoiding many lights and saving time. The POOL: See those photographs of the pool on the website? The pool does look just like that! If you go out to the pool early, you will have it all to yourself. The kiddie side w/ the slides doesn't open until 10am, but the rest opens at 8am. TIP: Pool deck slippery, wear flip flops at all times on the concrete! I managed to slip and break my toe - didn't know until I was all the way back in Rhode Island. Parking: Never a problem with parking. Plenty of spaces. Villa: I had a kitchen, dining room, living room and 2 bedrooms. All of it was spotless and everything in working order. 2 Jetted tubs. Beds were very comfortable, too! Tried them both! Only reason I didn't give and excellent? I was hit with an extra charge upon check in. I've never had to pay anything extra at a timeshare - not even in Las Vegas. It was "Accommodations Tax" of 6.93/day. Came to 48.51 for my stay. While it may be Las Vegas that charges this, I guess some of the other timeshares do not pass it on to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & quiet”
Reviews.Author: djohns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged here thru II for a 1 week 2 bdrm condo. It was nice, but nothing spectacular. Staff was friendly, pool was very nice and the grounds are well kept. The condo was supposed to accommodate 6, but I think anything more than 4 would have been crowded. The kitchen is nothing more than an oversized closet and the living room could only seat 4. The furniture in all rooms were all too big and made it difficult to move around. The bathrooms are very large and have huge whirlpools, however, they have a sign posted not to use the jets between 10 pm - 8 am. We had no trouble with the shuttle. They were quite punctual and ran extra shuttles during the peak hours. This was our first time in Vegas and I didn't think 3 miles off the strip would be bad, but next time I think we'll choose a place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Far enough away, yet close enough by car”
Reviews.Author: geedbee
Reviews.Content: This resort had good points and bad points. When I arrived I was able to check in early without a problem. The staff at the reception desk was very pleasant. The room was clean enough. However, I had a room facing the strip (nice view at night), bad part about that was the HUGE balcony was also a gathering place for pigeons (just the occasional one) and there were some droppings left on the balcony. Nothing a good power washing wouldn't fix. It was not a major problem, but something of wich you should be aware. Did not try the restaurants or the bars, but heard from other people that tey were (not unexpectedly) overpriced. The bedrooms were a little small compared to other two bedroom places in which I have stayed, but the bathroms were huge. The bathtub in the master batroom was big enough to accomodate two people very comfortably and while the one in the other bathroom couls easily accomodate two people it was not as roomy. The cloth placemats could probably be replaced as they were various colors of green (different stages of fade) and looked a bit used, but overall the property was nice. The price was about average of other places in the area and the only thing that really made it stand out from other like hotels in the area was the pool and the HUGEbattubs. Other than that, there was nothing in particular to reccommend this resort. Also there was plenty of free parking, only a very limited amount of it was underground and the hotel was located less than five minutes away from the freeway. The was a Food 4 Less across the street, a WalMart, Target and assorted fast food restaurants located fairly close (by car).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SophieMidlandsUk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at a great price and is very well situated if you want to be right next to the strip without the hassle of parking or having to walk the kids through casinos all the time. We had a 2-bed suite which was lovely and had everything we needed. Pool aread lovely and the kids loved the water slides. We didn't use the shuttle as you can park in any of the hotels on the strip for free. Only slight complaint was the check-in; took a long time and the line moved ridiculously slowly. They didn't seem to have any rooms ready early so loads of people were hanging around waiting to check in at 4pm..

Reviews.Title: “Our new Las Vegas destination”
Reviews.Author: CuTeAzNbOy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late Aug 2010 with my wife, 6 year old daughter and in-laws..Pool is great, staff are excellent..Shuttles to and from the strip (stops at new york hotel and casino). Rooms are very spacious as well with a king size bed. Had a wonderful view at the pool. We had an awesome stay at this resort and i would love to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: cdntrvlr55
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Cancun Resort was great. The staff keep the units very clean are friendly and very accommodating. The carpet was the only thing that was showing it's age and abuse but was spotless- which is much more preferred to dirty and new. The kitchen was very well equiped, even came with dish soap and DW detergent,unlike some others resorts we've stayed at. The grocery store is right across the street and very reasonable. The pool area was very nice and relaxing with areas you could go to have less commotion and the water slides were enjoyable even for me. We had a car and there is easy access to the freeway making transportation to and from the Strip or Fremont St. very easy. (plenty of free parking in the Casinos) It was usually 15-20 minutes to get to Treasure Island self park-easy in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Socalbail
Reviews.Content: Check in line was outrageous. Room was very small and large furniture that didn’t fit. Water pressure in the shower was a joke. Would not recommend

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best but No Reason not to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GOUSA9
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife and three kids at the beginning of August. Arrived at 3pm and was told if I didn't pre-register before 2pm I would have to check back some time before 4-5 pm to get my room. They did give a pool key to get by during that time. Got to the room and it wasn't bad. We were 1st floor pool side with very limited view. The bed was a Cal King. TV was really basic definatly atleast 8-10 yrs old. Nice jacuzzi bath. Kitchen was small but had a decent fridge. Frying pan was horrible, endded up buying a $5 pan at Target instead of repeating a 30 minute scrubbing party after cooking eggs. That would be the main thing I would recommend to have changed immediately. Overall it wasn't bad for a family. Nice pool! They policed people from bringing beverages & food at two of the pool entrances the first few days but that stopped a few days later. We brought down food and drink each day. The pool side food/bev service was kinda pathetic. Towels are $20 per towel if you don't bring back by 10pm. This was new and explained because they were much nicer towels. My opinion was they were YMCA quality. You do need to get down by 8am to get a good chair as well as pool lounges for the water. The water does have a very strong salty taste to it. Not sure if it was because they were looking for a Cancun approach or the fact that a ton of kids are in the pool each day. Parking is hit and miss with limited garage parking. We drove so their was no need for a shuttle. It's a 5-10 minute drive to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Roossiiee
Reviews.Content: my family and i had a great time here staff was friendly my boys 6 and 3 loved it we are coming back in 2 weeks can't wait

Reviews.Title: “I will visit there again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Excellence1
Reviews.Content: I have visited this property a several times within the last 4 years. I am not sure what has changed within the last 2 years or so since I have been there.....but things have definately improved. The staff is friendly and attentive, the grounds are very well maintained, and the overall feel is welcoming. Check in was smooth. My room was very clean, and the beds were comfortable. So if managment has changed...bravo to the change!!! My kids enjoyed the pool, while I enjoyed relaxing beside the pool. Going to Vegas with kids can usually be boring for us adults because all of the entertainment is on the strip and not kid friendly......however much to my surprise the cancun took care of that. There was a great band that played by the pool. There was also a band in the bar. It was nice to see that extra touch done, especially because I had my kids with me. The cancun is a place I will visit again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “*** Serious Air Conditioner Problems ***”
Reviews.Author: ca-beachcouple
Reviews.Content: We needed to be moved three times to get a room that the Air Conditioner worked. We spent our first night in a room that the A/C did'nt work, but could not take it for two more nights. The next day we were moved to another room that was hotter than hell. Finally the third room the A/C worked great. The elevators and hallways are 90+ degrees at all times. THERE ARE SERIOUS A/C PROBLEMS AT THIS HOTEL/TIMESHARE. THE POOL AREA: There are only about 10 umbrellas in the very large pool area. Las Vegas in July, August and September gets 110+ degrees outside. THERE IS NO PLACE TO GO FOR SHADE. MANAGEMENT, YOU NEED TO ORDER 50+ UMBRELLAS. POOL CAFE FOOD: It is very under staffed. It took over 30 minutes to get our order. The cooks were'nt the problem, it was they only had one lady at the counter. She had to take the orders AND deliver them, the food was all backed up, she was over loaded. I had the Santa Fe Wrap two days in a row and it was very good and my husband had a Turkey Sandwich, both for a reasonable price. The one person who worked very hard to get us a room with the A/C working was Blanca. Thank you Blanca!!! I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN. Management needs to make a lot of changes. Start putting some money back into your property. The first should be a new A/C system then umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you are going with children ... stay away ... and even with kids .. not good.”
Reviews.Author: bucklong
Reviews.Content: First, I will be positive. This resort has a beautiful pool ( but more on that later ) and unlike some "condo resorts" it's nice that it has a bar and cafe near the pool since some have no poolside amenities. And the rooms are nicely appointed ... we were in a 1 BR and it was nice ... granite, comfortable beds, nice bedding, spacious balcony ... but I suppose because it was intended to sleep 4 ... there were 2 full bathrooms and yet the kitchen was tiny. Space could have been better allocated by offering a decent kitchen and one full bath ... just my opinion. Beyond that ... not much good to say. I have nothing against children, have a few of my own in my family and I realize that kids need a vacation too ... but I was really upset to find out that although this resort's website advertises an "adult only" pool ... it's no where to be found. As you will see from pictures, the central point of the pool is a "Mayan Pyramid" with waterfall and waterslides. When we first arrived I was immediately tired of all the "screaming" of children etc. and I asked the lifeguard where the "adult" pool was. She looked at me like I was from another planet and said she knew nothing of it. Later in the week a bartender told me that they initially tried to have an adult pool but couldn't keep the kids out of the waterfall so they gave up. It really IS an issue if you just want to relax. Nothing against kids ... I know they want to have fun ... but when I book a place that says they have an adult pool I don't want to hear SCREAMING kids all day long as they play under the waterfall. Also, there is a hot tub under the pyramid that is supposedly "adults only" ... but nobody enforces it so the children run rampant and the hot tub is directly under the waterfall which is exactly where all the children want to play and scream. There is also an "adult lounge" with relaxing areas, tv, pool table & internet access ... watch out for the kids though ... they run the place and there doesn't seem to be ANY enforcement at all. I just needed 10 minutes on the computer in the course of the week ... to check emails and make some travel and business arrangements and I could barely concentrate because children were playing pool and yelling and screaming. Next, although this is a timeshare/hotel that says it is your home away from home ... they have a stringent policy that you are not allowed to bring ANY food or drink to the pool area. I partly understand, because if they are going to provide bar/cafe poolside ... they need people to buy stuff. But one of the main reasons many of us go to condos is because we can make a sandwich or cocktail and take it to the pool ... so that was very disappointing. I found it very frustrating that the rules at this resort are enforced sporadically ... what I mean is .... when you come to the pool there are "guards" that ask you what is in your beach bag to make sure you don't bring in food or drink .... but when it comes to enforcing any rules about the adult areas ... forget it! The service at this resort is lacking. While I was there, we had a brief power outtage. At the time I was in my room but just leaving for the pool. The power went out as I was in the hallway and it was PITCH BLACK ... no emergency lights ... people were scared and there was literally NO WAY to find your way either to an exit or back to your room. Many of us gathered together and found the stairs ... again no lights in the stairways ... we literally had to "feel" our way down 5 flights to the exit. No damage ... but if there had been a fire or otherwise? I tried to talk to "management" about it .... but they didn't care. I was told that it wasn't their fault ... the "exit" and emergency lights were supposed to be powered by the "back up" generator, but it didn't kick in. So again ... it wasn't their fault. The "lifeguards" at the pool do little, other than blow their whistles and enforce the food and drink policy. I honestly don't think I EVER saw ONE of them get off their stool ... they just shout at people over the din of the waterfall ... which no one seems to hear anyway. Honestly, this resort just needs to decide what it wants to be. It either needs to play up the aspect of being a family resort, which would be great ... expand the family and children activities, dump the bar in favor of an arcade and ice cream shack etc. ... or be a true "condo/hotel/resort" where all ages can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Notglamourous
Reviews.Content: This by far was the worst hotel experience I have ever experienced. I brought my daughter there for her 13th Birthday on a staycation. Very bad Idea. We were inconvenienced by finding bugs in our bed and had to move to another room and was not compensated for the inconvenience at all. And the pool area is like fort knox. We were met by a gate guard everytime we tried to enter the pool area and was asked for our room number while the gate guard searched through a print out of all guests for the weekend to find our name and then to tell us it was ok to proceed to the pool area. I have to tell you - looks can be deceiving on this one. Great looking place from the outside, but a totally different story inside. The room was very small and the kitchen was like a cracker jack box, yes that little. In my own opinion and the opinion of my very upset daughter, we will never visit this hotel again. Definitely would not recommend to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: TriGirl_23
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Cancun Resort in Vegas for a week for a family trip. We wanted to be close to, but not on, the strip, and the Cancun was very convenient to everything. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and had everything we needed, though I missed having a washer and dryer in the 2 bed/bath condo we stayed in. They did have laundry facilities on premises, but we made due and did laundry when we got home. The pool area was fantastic, we loved the 5 hot tubs, water slides and huge pool area and we used it alot, since it was hot! The staff was great, and when our daughter got a touch of heat exhaustion, they went out of their way to help us out. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pushy Timeshare People”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: We are owners with Monarch Grand. This was our second stay at the Cancun Resort. The resort and it's facilities are very nice! Beautiful grounds, very clean, wonderful pool with fun slides and attentive lifeguards. The rooms/villas are much bigger than normal hotel rooms with balconies, large whirlpool tub, and a kitchen with a full-size refrigerator and all the stuff you need to prepare meals - dishes, pots and pans, etc. Th on-site restaurants have good food at reasonable prices. We found two negatives with the Cancun Resort: 1.) After you check-in, they send you to a counter to get your on-site parking permit. Here you get attacked by the pushy timeshare sales people. They try hard to get you to attend a timeshare presentation in the hopes of separating you from some more of your cash. They're boarderline obnoxious, offering show tickets etc. if you'll attend the timeshare presentation. Sucks. 2.) WiFi is not free. It's $5 per hour or $20 for three days. The WiFi connection sucks! It's slow and very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: rx007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife, last week of March, 2010. We have stayed at several timeshares in Vegas. We will probably stay here again. Pros and Cons are as follows: Pros: 1) If you have a car - you will have no problem getting to where ever you want to go, everything is within minutes in the vegas area. 2) All rooms are equipped with a small kitchen and all utensils available including coffepot, toaster, blender, stove, fridge. 3) Laundry room on each floor for a small charge 4) Nice size balcony areas if you want to sit outside 5) Pool area is good size - if you want the quiet side, just stay away from the slide area which is located behind the pyramid waterfall. 6) Two restaurants on property around the pool area. 7) Underground garage parking or outside parking Cons: 1) Staff is not very helpful - probably not paid enough to care 2) If you do not have a car - the shuttle is not that reliable - taxi's are not cheap. 3) Restaurants are a little pricey - so you may think about buying your own groceries or eating at fast food places. Food was just ok. Nothing spectacular for the price. All in all, compared to the other time shares we have stayed at in vegas, this one wins over Club de Soleil because of the pool size - and rooms are bigger here. Wins over Polo Towers - again pool size and the polo towers are very dated and rooms are smaller too! Advantage of Polo Towers and Jockey Club are that they are on the strip. Grand Chateau outshines all of the timeshares because it is the newest and on the strip, only downfall with Grand Chateau - it has a very small pool area, probably the smallest of all. Grand Hilton Vacation Club advantage is that it is on the other end of the strip and the rooms are newer - pool is not as big as Cancun's. Of all these places, I would stay at Cancun again before the others - Depends on what your are looking for-

Reviews.Title: “You can't believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: HuaracheRotos
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews that pictured this resort in a bad light but our experience with the Cancun Las Vegas resort and the employees of this resort was excellent. I have traveled all over the world through our El Cid timeshare so without hesitantion I reserved a two bedroom stay at the Cancun Las Vegas Resort with friends. Upon reading the other reviews, I was worried that I had made a mistake but was I absolutely wrong. We under-estimated our time and subsequently missed our flighted due to the long check-in at Southwest airlines and security. Only one of our party was able to leave on time and arrived earlier than ourselves. She arrived and was recieved by Juvi, the receptionist at Cancun Las Vegas, and allowed to enter our reserved room early to wait before we arrived. The other members of our party were able to arrived later that same day and were shown to the room. I was not able to arrived until the following morning since I was placed on stand- by on Southwest. Upon my arrival, I though wow this is a nice resort. Very clean and the decor is very Mayan, not Aztec, although the pyrimid near the pool Aztec in shape. The pool area is very nice and everyone was very friendly and helpful. I entered our room and boy it was nice and clean. The kitchen is small but was well stocked with cooking utensils and dishes. There was a stove with an oven and dishwasher. Yes it is small but if you need anything bigger than stay home. There was always someone outside taking care of the grounds, pool or building. As for location to the Strip, yes the complimentary resort shuttle starts at 12 noon but take the bus. A 24 hour pass cost $7.00 and can be caught across the street. Just be carefull crossing the street later in the day. Traffic is dense in the afternoon and evening. We crossed the street in the morning and caught the bus to the terminal where we transfered onto the Duece to the Strip. The same bus ticket can be used to get on and off while visiting all the major hotels along the Strip. The bus pass was a money saver and we made it pay off. There is a CVS half a block down to the left where inexpensive souvenirs can be found. Steiner's is a great place to catch a bit to eat. Any the waiters are very friendly, they seem to be ready for a real good time. There is also a Food 4 Less in a little strip mall behind the CVS. Therefore, the location was really great. We even walked to the Target about 2 miles away but needed to take a taxi back. Jamaria called the taxi service three times when the taxi never arrived. She was very friendly and efficient. Never with an attitude nor impatient so I guess the employees refered to in the other reviews must have been fired. My friends loved the Cancun Las Vegas resort so much so they only wished they owned a timeshare to return there. They definitely took lots of pictures and could not be silent to the compliments rendered to the resort. They definitely will share their experience to their family and friend. I am already planning a family trip to stay at the Cancun Las Vegas resort in the near future. So don't always believe what you read, you just have to experience it yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible srvice”
Reviews.Author: dissapointedMiami_Fl
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel or recommend it to anyone. The rooms were o.k but that's about it. The shuttle took us to the strip around noon ans at night time around 10:00 p.m when we went to take the shuttle back to the hotel we waited 2 hours and they never arrived, that's when i decided to call the hotel and was told that the route had been changed taround 6:00 Pm to another location and were not able to even give me directions to get there. There was no one out there to inform the people that were still on the stripof this change. i was traveling with both of my parents one of them dissabled. we were soaking wet because it was raining and were very cold.We ended up taking a cab back to the hotel and when i arrived there i tried to get reimburst for the cab and all i got was a very rude and obnocious staff refussing to pay for my cab. I woul never recommend this hotel to anyone because obviously they give a damm about their customers, they care less about what happens to you or your family

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion”
Reviews.Author: FaithA
Reviews.Content: This ia an awesome time-share resort with full kitchens, beautiful ammenities and great service. I always stay here, they offer a shuttle to downtown, shopping is close and the pool is fantastic. They have a smal spa on site and 2 restaurants that are casual. Great for kids.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: peggy64
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality and service we received. The breakfastes (included with our stay) were wonderful -not the "cereal and toast' we were expecting. Our room was large and clean - loved the huge balcony. We were not pressured to buy into the time-share ( We will not be returning to Vegas and Mexico is not a place we have ever considered visiting) We rented a car so being off the strip was no problem- parking on the strip was easy to find and free! We would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and off the Strip but easy to get around from by taxi or car”
Reviews.Author: Bunchkin
Reviews.Content: The resort rooms are showing its age and the rooms on the floor below us had carpets replaced and after our first week there was a surprise move for us as carpets were being replaced on our floor. No assistance was given and it was a phone call to move now. The pool was very nice and the water slides entertained the young people. The grounds were park like and the grounds keepers were very professional about their jobs. However the front desk staff often appeared to be bothered by your presence. One of the managers was helpful in finding us an adequate room when we had to move but there is no empowerment of staff at the front. We had done a time share exchange and since we are not owners there were only certain rooms/building that we were suppose to be in - we have noted that before on exchanges and sometimes it is the most undesirable room or location that is given. On our move of rooms we saw what a regular room in the oldest building was and it was a huge improvement - almost like we were 2nd class. We did not rent a car as the resort provided a shuttle - make sure you know how it works so you don't get left behind one eveing and don't be in a hurry. One of the outlet stores is about a 20 minute walk away and there are restaurants across the street as well as a large grocery store. Just remember to buy only what you can carry as sometimes the traffic is busy and you have to wait awhile until it is safe to cross - we filled our back packs making it easier. There is a drug store a block away and other strip mall shops across the street as well. If your expectations are not too high this place is fine. Very small kitchen for a family in a two bedroom suite and the 2nd bedroom is very small with only a wee bit of walking room around the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dfhawk60
Reviews.Content: This stay was an Interval exchange. Very nice stay, the room was clean and equipped with just enough space. quick check in, friendly staff, great temperature controlled pools. Lots of shopping and restaurants near by. easy access to the highway for longer trips, and just minuets by car from the casinos. There was courtesy shuttle to/from the strip, food4less groceries right across the street. But i do recommend renting a car. Book the car on-line for a much better price than walking in. the taxi's seemed a bit steep from the air port, $25 per person more than double the ride to the center of the strip

Reviews.Title: “good family choice”
Reviews.Author: quinoSydney
Reviews.Content: With a family of 6 we found the resort ideal - though the bed configuration had our twin boys 11 sharing a sofa bed in the lounge room which wasn't ideal - but alas that is a constant problem when travelling with a tribe outside the nuclear family. Hotel rooms are nice and the grounds and pool are very well maintained. We had a car so we found the short 5-10 minute drive to the strip very convenient - plus plenty of free parking. The big attraction for us was the waterslides - which the kids loved. Supermarket opposite was very handy as the room was self contained plus the outlet centre was only 5 minutes - great shopping! Note, we extended for 1 nite and found the spot rate at the hotel far cheaper than booking on expedia.com.

Reviews.Title: “BE VERY CAREFUL!”
Reviews.Author: kruseranch
Reviews.Content: We booked the Cancun through Bookit.com which said that free breakfasts and Internet were included. Well, according to the Cancun that was NOT the case. When we showed them our Internet booking printout, they did give us breakfast vouchers and also gave us coded coupons for free Internet for three days. One of the coded coupons didn't work so we took it down to the front desk the next day and were told by some manager that they wouldn't give us another code that worked because they weren't supposed to give us the free Internet in the first place! Now, we did do the 90 minute timeshare tour the day before. We didn't buy into that racket so we wonder if they decided to treat us the way they did because we didn't buy a timeshare?? The villa's were very nice but we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort--please don't nickle and dime us, though....”
Reviews.Author: Trespinos
Reviews.Content: We exchanged to stay here through I.I. over New Year's Eve, and did enjoy both the resort and the experience. The facility is about 4 miles from the Strip, but that was fine with us as we enjoyed the respite and we had our own car. The 2-BR unit was large and comfortable, with a satisfactory kitchen and 2 bathrooms that included whirlpool tubs. Closets were surprisingly tight, given that folks generally stay at these resorts for a week. The Mayan Pyramid waterslides/pool represent inspired architecture: We enjoyed wandering the area even though it was too cold to swim or slide. Primary complaint is the niggling costs for everything: Wi-fi? Yes, but it's $29.95/week PER computer and, like any modern family, we had 3 of 'em. $90/week for internet access was extremely annoying. Video rentals? Sure, but it's $7 each--when you can get them at Redbox for a buck. Kids' arcade? Yes, but the tokens cost as much as they do at Round Table. C'mon... This is the kind of thing that leaves a bad taste...

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort & still on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DonnaYeeSanchez
Reviews.Content: We are owners w/Monarch Grand Vacations, and even though we own a 2 bdrm unit, a one bdrm unit is sufficient, because you only there to enjoy the town, shop, sight see and eat and gamble. We came w/our 2 children,ages 4 & 11. Granted it was chilly and it is December, right before Xmas- but the town and attractions are great. Everyone just gotta checkout the new CrystalCityCentre- its awesome and then there is a monorail that will contact right over to the Bellagio. Kitchen in the unit is a bit tight, but OK- got the basic essentials to prepare a meal. Once you pull out the sofabed in the livingroom, rm is a bit snug, but hey, they've got a full bathroom and an enclosure to the living room for some privacy. Pool Area is really nice, but too cold to try out in December. Concierge and frontdesk and rest of staff very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: marshqld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cancun for 3 days as the kids were nagging us to see Hoover Dam. Was surprised of the quality of the rooms. When I booked the room through hotels.com it stated that the room would sleep five when in actually it only sleeps 4 noting one room has a king size bed and a queen bed with no sleeper sofer. The room was clean and modern with huge spa baths adjoined to each room. My biggest gripe was that there was no free wireless internet and was expensive at $9.95 per day. Great pool facility with waterslide for the kids. Beds were clean and comfortable with each room having a tv which was good for the kids. Free Shuttle bus to the strip was also very handy. Would stay here again. Staff were very courteous and frendly.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasent stay at Cancun Resort ( a time share)”
Reviews.Author: vegascalling
Reviews.Content: my husband and i checked in on a tuesday evening- the room was nice- king sized bed and tv in bedroom / a couch that pulls out and a chair and tv in livingroom- a dinning table for 4 & a full kitchen- stove, dishwasher, microwave, full size fridge. we had two bathrooms- one off the livingroom- with a stand up shower and sink and toilet- the bigger bathroom was off the bedroom it had a two sinks, toilet and huge jetted tub for 2. everything was clean and tiddy except the carpet had stains in more than a few places throughout the villa. It was too cold to swim when we were there - but the pool looked beautiful from our balcony. i do have a suggestion for any single travelers- i would request to be in the main building - no one is at the doors in the parking garadges and we had a problem with a man pulling the door out of our hands cause he didn't have a room key and then proceeded to yell and act beligerant! security was called and never came- i went the next morning to complain that no one even took a reoport about this<Security was a joke- they didn't seam at all concerned and said i could fill out a report if i wanted to. this was free to us --as sister used her points- they tried to get us to listen to the time share pitch- but we declined!!!! sister joined us for a few days- she wasn't pleased with a few things as well. over all - a clean decent place to stay- way too far from all the fun. if you want it quiet and away from the action- then this is the place- but you couldn't pay me to stay there if i didn't have a rental car. the shuttle is a joke AND stops at midnight- and a cab four miles from mandalay bay- is Ridiculous!!!also they require a $100 deposit for god only knows what!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: pristar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort to stay in!! I really felt as if i was in CanCun, the pool is huge & so nice, My room was almost the size of my house. I love the Comfortable bed, huge bathroom, very nicely decorated, calm/relaxing environment, & excellent price. Absolutely loved it & will definitly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dosami
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel fo 2 days and had a great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful all around. The room was in great shape, clean and comfortable and spacious with a view of The Las Vegas Strip (albeit off in the distance) The location about 3 miles from the Stirp was great for my family away from the hustle of LV. Restaurants, shopping (Oulet Mall and Groceries) close . Courtesy shuffle to The Strip was convenient The resort is themed like a Mexican Resort and was impressive. Parking garage was locked at night and felt very secure Free internet would have been a bonus. Wireless is available but cost of $9.95 per 24 hrs If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay in Vegas THIS IS THE PLACE

Reviews.Title: “So glad we didn't stay on the strip, lovely rooms, great pool”
Reviews.Author: UnitedKingdomSuzyR
Reviews.Content: After seeing the hotels with casinos on the strip and the amount of walking and vast lobbies we were so glad we stayed at the Cancun, which was so quiet, with lovely rooms a fantastic pool and parking convenient to each room. We liked it so much we returned for another 4 nights later in our holiday. The staff were friendly, the room was delightful and the beds comfortable. We had a small apartment (termed a villa), We had a central dining area with small kitchenette off. The small lounge area had a very comfy fold out queen bed for our son and he had his own bathroom whilst next door we had a nice spacious feeling master bedroom with a huge his and hers bathroom with ample spa bath. All in all we felt it a home from home and a retreat from a trip to the strip! We used the shuttle and also drove our car into the strip using I15 and found it easy to park in the casino parking. Across the road from the hotel is a good selection of eating places - much cheaper than the strip, plus a useful food store, gas station and pharmacy -- everything you could need. Recommend Outback Steakhouse, and IHOP for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...........”
Reviews.Author: beachloversPA
Reviews.Content: Before we went to the Cancun resort we read here how unfriendly the staff was, we didn't run into that at all. They were courteous and helpful at check in and assisted us with printing our boarding passes before we left. The condos themselves, at least the two bedroom we had, are smaller than the other condos where we have stayed. It was very clean though and quiet. But then this is Vegas and how much time are you going to be at your condo. The pool was absolutely beautiful but we couldn't figure out while the temperatures were in the mid 90's to low 100's the water felt as if it were about 60 degrees. We were not the only ones that thought the water was too cold. A couple of nights we did hear a few people that had been celebrating a little too much as they returned but only lasted a couple of minutes, and not that long after we returned for the evening. The resort is less than 10 minutes from the strip, we didn't use the shuttle at all and found that if you use back streets you can get to some of the parking decks at the casinos without having to deal with all the traffic of the strip. If you want to get away from all the glitz and glamour of the strip take a trip up to Freemont Street. Its old Vegas and is much more laid back than the strip and found it to be a pleasant change. Overall it is a nice resort and would return here again if we ever travel to Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: CB1178
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this resort last week-9/25. We booked a room through our timeshare and also got one for two of our friends. The rooms were spectacular and the beds were even better! All four of us raved about the beds. The rooms each had kitchens, 2 bathrooms, and the living room can be closed off to make a second bedroom. The pool was great too, although we were so busy we barely spent any time in it, except to try out the waterslides, which were awesome. The only downfall is that the hotel is about 3 miles from the strip. they advertise a shuttle, but it is VERY unreliable, and it only runs from 12-12. I would just rent a car next time. I will definately be back to the CANCUN RESORT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Islandsue
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for my daughter's wedding the week of 9/6-9/13. I own a timeshare at Polo Towers but since they were full for the time I needed, I was able to exchange a banked week for my Mom and two brothers for the Cancun resort. While it quite a ways from the strip, it worked for us since I rented a car for the week. I don't know how people do it otherwise! We got a two bedroom, two bath unit on the 5th floor. Love the unit and the view of the mountains. Very happy with the resort all in all. We spent more time at the pool than I thought we would. The drinks were not too expensive considering what they charge on the strip. One vodka tonic was $5.50, but I WAS charged a $3.00 "up charge". What the heck? The restaurant food needs revamping, in a big way. They are seriously missing a great opportunity here. Someone from this resport should spend a few day in Mexico and see how they treat their guests and what kind of food/drinks they are serving. My goodness.... It would be great to have fish taco's, tropical salads, fresh fruit & cheese platters offered to guests as they lounge around the pool. Why isn't anyone walking around the pool offering guests signature drinks. Lovely tropical drinks would be delightful. Instead, they had bar food fare; wings, french fries, nachos. The only thing I could find on the menu that wasn't fried was a turkey sandwich, and it was good. We own three timeshares and are able to move them (exchange) to various places all the time. Never ever have we been charged anything anywhere we have stayed. Only this resort charged us a $6.93 daily "Accommodation Tax". Weird. To leave this review on a possitive note, the property and the unit was very clean and spacious. Yes, the kitchen is rather small, but still functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort near the Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: jkhotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend here at the Cancun Resort before school started for the kids. There is nothing bad you can say about the hotel itself. The one bedroom villa was very clean (except for the fact that there was a couple of sunflower seeds near the balcony), pool area is very nice, and open amenities and lobby are nicely put together and clean. The only problem is that the pool staff later at night were not very friendly. Seeing as how it was almost 10pm closing maybe they just wanted to go home. Housekeeping staff were also a little loud while in the elevator with them, and one housekeeper was painting her nails in the elevator! Another problem that I found at the resort is that it is not very kid friendly. The Caribe Lounge did not except minors into the restaurant so we couldn't eat their and were told to eat somewhere else. Also there was no free internet which was a big dissapointment! *** Big thank you to Michael at the Concierge desk! By attending the owners meeting we were given 4 complementary tickets to Steve Wyrick's magic show which was a fabulous show. We were given great seats and moved up toward the front a little too! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: bucketofbolts
Reviews.Content: The resort is excellent, with only one negative comment which I will address first. They offer a complimentary shuttle to the strip. Hours of operation is good, but the van is to small considering the # of owners and guest that use the service. Plus vans are up in age and should be replace with buses. We stayed in the penthouse, which speaks for itself, we have taken our grand kids on several occasions, and the first thing they want to do is rant and rave to their parents about how good the activities and wonderful the big rooms. The staff and housekeepingwas much more than I expected. Did not see any sales staff, which was a real plus this time. The grounds of the resort are well maintained. Would highly recommend this resort, and would come back here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: sofiafina6
Reviews.Content: We are owners at this place so when we got there, the (obnoxious) front desk people told us that our rooms weren't ready. (check in is at 4:00 and it was past , close to 5:00) the lady did not apologized and did not care to please us in any way. So we waited over two hours... We asked for a key to the pool (at least the kids could get wet while we waited) They finally gave us one of the rooms, except the penthouse and the other room, so when they finally informed us that the room was ready, i went to get the key. The lady wanted to see an i.d. ( are you serious?) did not bring one with me it was in the car... She refused to give me the key. After the two hours, you'd think they'd be more friendly, at at least understanding... Nope, i asked to speak to a supervisor, and he too was an a...hole. After what it seemed an eternity, he asked for several personal information and reluctantly gave me the keys... the next day i needed to print something out from the place they have and on the computer it said i needed to buy a card from the front desk... so here we go again... all i needed to know was the minimum of minutes i needed to buy to use the internet okay? So one of the clerks is on the phone and I stood in front of her to ask her the question-nothing. A gentleman came over and called the next person in line, I approached him and said, "i just have a quick question" and he said " There is a line" . Yes, there was a line, but they all had cards, as if they were ready to check out. I left.

Reviews.Title: “Wished it was closer to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KatfromLQ
Reviews.Content: We exchanged one of our timeshare weeks for this resort. Rooms are great though kitchen is a little small. Very clean and bed was very comfortable. TVs in main room and bedroom are kind of small. I needed internet which you have to pay $ 30.00 per week for. The pool was great and water very refreshing after laying in hot sun. Our kids (tweens) only used the water slides once which surpised me. At the towel hut you can check out a float for the pool at no cost which is nice. Lounge chairs under the umbrellas or palms trees are in high demand. We had an "owner" accuse us of moving his towels from the lounges after we had been sitting there for over 1 1/2 hours. I guess owners/guests rush down at 8:00 am and put towels on the lounges they want to "reserve" and then come down whenever they want to. We hadn't moved his towels but offered to move down but he turned really ugly and thank goodness he decided to move somewhere else. Later his wife walked by and made a snide comment to my husband in front of our kids. That experience really turned us off. We have never encountered someone like that on vacation. My husband and kids ate at the restaurant and said it was "okay" but overpriced. I thought we would utilize the kitchen but other than using the refrigerator for leftovers and making toast a few morning we didn't use the kitchen. We didn't use the shuttle because we like to be able to come and go as we please. Normally we stay in a hotel on the strip but decided to try a timeshare away from the strip. It didn't work for us. The kids really like being on the strip and because hotel rooms are so reasonable next time we will just stay on the strip. There were a lot of families with small children and I think this resort works great for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: Our stay was arranged by friends who own the time share. We were checked in efficiently by the friendly staff and were surprised to find that our friends were kind enough to book us a penthouse! It was large and top-notch, very clean (spotless, in fact except for the coffee maker which still had a used filter in it - okay, that's a small thing and easy to overlook). Most importantly, the beds were very comfortable and the place was dead quiet, probably the quietest hotel room I ever stayed in -- and that is saying something! That's mainly because you can't slam a door if you wanted - they have a mechanism that doesn't allow the door to slam. Now why don't ALL hotels have that!!! The pool was beautiful and perfect for swimming. We loved going under the waterfall and I even went on the water slides and I am not exactly a spring chicken. We didn't eat there, so I can't comment on the food or the room service. And since we didn't pay ourselves, I have to skip the "value' rating. I really can't fault anything except the location because it is 2 miles south of Mandalay Bay, but it is normally a quick drive on the expressway to where the action is, and it has a very convenient exit at Blue Diamond Road.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't you get BETTER service than the average hotel if you pay 10k?”
Reviews.Author: LosingPebbles
Reviews.Content: Overall I was fairly disappointed in the Cancun resort. There were a few positive things I can say but they were mostly overshadowed by the poor attitude of the front desk staff. PROS: Location - Close to the strip but far enough away that it's not so busy and loud Pool - Beautiful pool area. We didn't utilize it while we were there but it was obviously popular. Room Service - I was very pleased by how affordable this option was and the two times we did order it the food arrived in a very timely manner. Shuttle Hours - Your in Las Vegas .. the strip is why many, many people come - your shuttle should run past 12AM. It would also be nice if they had 1-2 more stops. Perhaps one in the middle or one at the other end of the strip. It's quite a hike in the midday heat. Bathrooms - We liked that our room had 2 bathrooms. One in the Master Bedroom with a shower over a jacuzzi tub, and another off of the living room with just a shower. It makes it great if your traveling with friends you don't want coming through your bedroom in the middle of the night to go to the restroom. CONS: Staff - The staff in general was my biggest complaint. I work for Marriott and in the hospitality industry so I know what I'm looking for service wise - this staff didn't have it. Half the time they passed us off to the concierge who then told us to go ask the front desk. The morning before we left I had 2-3 things to ask the desk agent. Between each of the items (may I have an envelope, may I buy a stamp, can you make this and my Netflix please) the agent left me and went behind a door to continue her conversation with another staff member. The only POSITIVE staff I had interation with was the shuttle staff. Shuttle - It was a good to have the option but could be improved. Room - Kitchen should be larger. Compared to the kitchen at our home resort in Lake Tahoe it was like cooking in a closet. Housekeeping - On the day they were to service our room they knocked, we answered and asked them to return in 5 minutes so we could put on shoes etc. etc to go out while she cleaned. She said ok but when we returned after driving around for 1 1/2 hours our room still wasn't cleaned. I called the housekeeping manager and explained and told them to forget servicing the room as we were checking out 2 days early. 5 minutes later the girl arrived with her cart again to clean the room. We are returning to Vegas in March of 2010 for my 30th birthday but I'll pay to stay on the Strip instead of wasting another timeshare week. One would think that you would get BETTER service than the average hotel considering what you fork over to purchase a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life! If I could give it a negative number I would!”
Reviews.Author: armysniperwife
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying this trip was supposed to be one to celebrate my husbands birthday (last year he was serving in Iraq for his birthday), a getaway to make up for the honeymoon we never got and a time to meet up with my extended family (including my brother who left to deploy the day after we got back). We were very much looking forward to this trip. We were staying in a two bedroom with a pullout couch with a total of three couples arriving at three different times. Arrangements had been made by my cousin (the timeshare holder) for this resort to be in my name so we could check in a day earlier than she and her spouse. Upon arrival, the hotel could not find our reservation. It took them 30 mins and lots of us and them calling around to find it. Once they finally did we were let into our room. After running around and finally getting settled in my husband and I decided to sit down and have a nice quiet night and watch a movie. We first noticed buttons were missing off the actual tv but didn't think much of it. But then when I went to pick up the remote, the batteries flew across the room because there was no back on it! I decided it wasn't that big of a deal and went on. We then proceeded to try to watch a movie only to find the dvd player was broken and making a huge loud popping noise. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. It took him running back and forth to find a new dvd player and an hour to hook it up. The next morning my husband opened the dresser to put our clothes away only to have our dresser fall apart! We again called front desk and they sent maint again. After trying for a while to fix it then leaving and coming back he decided he couldn't fix it and had to find another one. The first morning after my cousin arrived, she woke to roll over and find a pair of mens underwear that did not belong to anyone in our party! We immediately called the housekeeping to notify of her findings only to have them tell her they must belong to her husband! She then hung up and called the front desk to complain of all the issues building up and also to let them know of the panels that are coming off the wall near the balcony of our wonderful view of the parking lot. They said it being memorial day weekend they could only move us to another room and have no other sister hotels to send us to or rooms to upgrade us to. We had to then pack up all of our belongings and groceries we had bought for a week and move everything to a completely different building. The hotel did not even offer to help! They only thing they could do to make up for it was a dinner off site (we refused to eat at their horrible restaurant). Which when it came time for us to get our vouchers and go to dinner they were not at the front desk. So they had to track down the GM to get them. All the while we missed the shuttle and had to pay for a taxi! We also had her comp us a few drinks at the pool but she was not happy about having to do both. Our room had two bathrooms, so one bathroom was shared by four people. Knowing this, housekeeping still only gave us enough towels for two people. The bedrooms do not have any fans and the air barely worked in our room so my husband and I sweat it out every night. We had the ac on the lowest it would go but still nothing! After sleeping in our new bed my husband and I both noticed we were itchy. We didn't think much of it until after the next night when we were both bright red and covered in hives. We had welts all over our bodies that itched like crazy! I called to the front desk and they said we must just be allergic to their detergant and that it wouldn't help to get new sheets. It did not seem very likely to us that we were both allergic to the same detergant and that we were fine in the first room but not his one! I told her to send the sheets anyways. When we got home we noticed they brought new sheets but rather than put them on they just left them on the table near the door! After we put the new sheets on the day we left we finally started to get better. The shuttle was nice to have but only runs until midnight. So you do not get a ride home if you plan on going home late. All the drivers had different rules and if there were a lot of people waiting you had to wait for the next time which could be an hour. A taxi back to the hotel is a minimum of $20 but will often run you double that with the traffic. We had to use the taxi more often then planned because they had one shuttle broke down so rather than the 15 min wait time they advertise, you wait more like 30. I will say that they nicest people we came across were two of the shuttle drivers. The restaurant at the pool is awful. They are incredibly overpriced. The chicken wings were very over priced and I must say the worst I've ever had. The frozen margaritas out of the machine were great though. But did cost you $12. The pool is large and has water slides but it got extremely crowded on the weekend. There were not enough chairs for people, but plenty of room where they could have bought them. I guess the hotel was too cheap for that. We had six people in our room but were only allowed to check out one pool float per room! They had a cookout for the weekend that we decided to purchse food from. We went to the food only to find you must go to the restaurant on the other side of the pool area to stand in line to purchase tickets then come back to the food to stand in line to get your food! We did this and when it was our turn to get our food they ran out!! They were not sure if they would get anymore, but finally came up with some 30 minutes later. The only reason we were able to get food was because we happened to walk up and check to see if any was there right before it had once again run out. The organization and planning of this hotel is a disgrace. After staying at this hotel I will NEVER purchase a timeshare. I will NEVER EVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE! This is the worst hotel on the market. I am highly disappointed. Especially after reading so many great reviews. I could go on and on about how much this hotel ruined our trip but I will stop. I think you get the point. It was awful and completely ruined our trip. Oh and my husband and I just finally got our hives, redness and severe itching to go away today...one week after being home! DO NOT stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lock your valuables in the safe”
Reviews.Author: derekaten
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience staying at the Cancun resort. I came with a group of eight we checked in to 2 rooms penthouse and a one bed room. My wife and I after checking in to the one bed room decided to see if we could upgrade to a 2 bed room. After a couple of hours by the pool we went to the front desk and they had a 2 bed room available. We packed up our stuff and moved to the 2 Bedroom. The next day my wife realizes that she left her engagement and wedding band rings in the bathroom of the one bed room. We called security and met up with them in the room. We just missed house cleaning and the rings were gone. We filed a police report and the investigation is open.... On a different note the gym was awful with minimal equipment and tight space. If you had three people running on the treadmills the power would trip in the room. One of the elliptical machines didn't work which was annoying. Front Desk and Security were very helpful but I wish I never had to go to security in the first place. The rooms were nice and clean and the penthouse room was large. Unfortunately they assign rooms first come first serve... That means if you are an owner in the time share you can get stuck with a bad view of the construction and a non-owner gets the amazing view you should get. I will not be going back or recommend any of my friends to stay at the Cancun resort in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SooZQ
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for our daughters wedding at the Bellagio. Our son, his wife and 8 month old stayed with us. The Cancun was the perfect place to spend the week where we could "get away" from the craziness of the strip. It was very quiet, clean, and had a beautiful pool area. We exchanged our Mexican timeshare for this 2 bedroom condo. As many have said, the rooms are a little dated, but roomy and comfortable, especially great with having a baby with us. We never used a shuttle as our son had his car with him. The drive into town was quick and easy. The airport, grocery store, several restaurants, and shopping were conveniently close. We were happy to find a washer & dryer in our building. Something to be aware of, some 2-bedrooms have a Queen bed in the 2nd room, some have 2 twin beds. We were NEVER approached about touring or purchasing a timeshare - we were pleasantly surprised about that. If I were to point out any negative, it would be the main bathroom. The shower head was badly in need of a vinegar soak so there would be decent pressure and waterflow. A lightbulb was out in the bathroom - took about 4 calls to get someone there to replace it. The pool area is probably the biggest plus for the Cancun. There was pleasant music playing, there were several hammocks to lay with the baby for a nap, and ample tables and chairs. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_WASunlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short 3 day stay. We were looking to relax by the pool and have the option to be in the middle of the excitement if we wanted to. Upon arrival, our check in was very quick and friendly. We were pleasantly surprised at our room. I had requested a pool view, not only did they make sure we had that, it was on the top floor with one of the best views you can get of the resort! Sure, the rooms are dated a little. That didn't matter to us though. The staff at the resort was very nice and we were not approached one time about the timeshare bit. We were kind of on guard about that. One of the resturaunts was closed which also didn't matter much. The Caribe lounge did the trick. Really we just used that for snacks and drinks. We only wish they had a swim up bar, we may not have spent as much time laying in the chairs getting burnt!!!! So, I only have one complaint about the resort and it's not really something that they can control.... There is a rule about no outside food and drink in the pool area, they were pretty relaxed about that rule as long as you were bringing your drinks in plastic cups. As the day went on, we noticed one VERY LARGE FAMILY that had staked their claim on several tables and brought in all of their own food, drinks and stereo!!!!!!!! The resort has great music playing all the time so I don't know what their deal was. I really wanted to say something to the resort staff because I truely felt that this family was detracting from the wonderful ambiance the pool area had. We were there to relax and have fun though so I decided to order another drink and ignore them!!!!!!! I guess that's what it's all about. One last thing, other reviewers complained about the long wait for the shuttle to the strip. They had 2 shuttles running the entire time and we never waited more than 5 minutes!!! They really did a great job. We really did enjoy this resort and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: Mikey000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 3 children have just returned from a spring break trip here. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 6 person suite. It had a 1 king and one queen and a pull out bed settee. The kitchen was well supplied. No need to bring beach towels as they are provided down by the pool. The resort has 2 pools and a number of hot tubs. There are waterslides. The staff from front desk to house keeping were very helpful. The place was clean and tidy and of a high standard. I would recommend hiring a car but there is a shuttle bus provided which takes you to the Tropicana Hotel in about 10mins There is a grocery store across the street as well as a CVS pharmacy. Your are only 5 minutes from the Las Vegas Outlet Mall and restaurants and 10 minutes from the airport. Excellent trip would highly recommend The gym was small for the size of the complex and got a bit crowded and stuffy

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but timeshare talk was annoying”
Reviews.Author: Americansportswriter
Reviews.Content: The hotel gets a 9 out of 10 from me. About 3 miles south of the major casinos on the Las Vegas Strip, it's a little quieter but convenient. Great price, very clean rooms, superb pool, friendly staff. The only downside was twice being asked about buying a timeshare. I didn't go there to be pitched. I came for vacation and was treated rudely once when turning them down. Kinda put a damper on the place. So, if you can handle being pitched, stay there. It's a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: VancouverJohn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at Cancun Resort during spring break.I booked a 2bdr (strip view) through Expedia for about USD$60 night.For this price you probably get a one star motel elsewhere, especially during spring break, so nobody should complain.The resort is very well maintained since there are also rooms available for time share purchase.The kids had a blast at the pool and slides, we had some very warm days in the middle of the week.The room was very large with two bathrooms, both with whirpool tubs.Stuff very friendly and helpful.Very dissapointed with the shows on the strip, few new shows, very few kids friendly and etremely expensive (such as Cirque de Soleil shows).I would definitely recommend the resort for families with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Lullybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Strip for one week and then wanted to get out of the crowds and the dirty streets so moved here for our second week! What a great move! The whole complex was spotless - which is really important to me. The pool area was just perfect - used the pool every day. Free shuttle service to the Strip and back (until midnight). Grocery store and pharmacy just across the street. Outlet Malls a brisk 15 minute walk north. Bus service right outside the door - we utilized the bus service daily - easy to use and friendly drivers. Only two complaints - charged for wi-fi internet access (should be free) and very, very uncomfortable living room furniture! The mattress in the master bedroom is just about ready for a change as well. Other than that, loved the place and would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but a good distance from the action.”
Reviews.Author: T-Ruckus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend with some friends as one of them had a timeshare here. We got a pretty nice room with two bedrooms and jacuzzis in both bathrooms. I say jacuzzis, but these things were like two person hot tubs. They were big and deep. They had three TVs, full kitchen, etc. The balcony was huge and had a nice view of the strip even though we wanted a pool view room. In any case, the beds were queens, but we could have used more pillows. Since we did not notice this until about 4 am, we did not bother them with this request. The pool area is beautiful. Although it was a little chilly when we were there, there are two big pools, one with a few large waterslides that looked really fun. I'm sure this is overrun by small children in the warmer seasons. There are five hot tubs including one underneath a waterfall. This is relaxing, but loud and not conducive to conversation. There are others with hammocks around them and what not. Very nice groups with a huge replica of a Mayan pyramid in the middle. No outside food or drink as I was told by my nervous 18 year old lifeguard, because you have to buy theirs from the cafe and/or bar. We just brought ours down anyway and poured it in cups. Everyone else did too, so stop cryin! The fitness center was more of a closet. Nevertheless, I managed to get a very good workout in with the equipment that they have. You just have to think outside the box a little. The thing that bother me though was that the circuit kept blowing for the treadmills, so we had to keep flipping the switch in the circuit box. This probably happened every five minutes when two of the three treadmills were being used simultaneously. As for the location, it is about five miles from the heart of the strip. Not bad for a short drive. The shuttle stops at 12, which pretty much makes it useless as that is when people need a DD. But if you want to avoid the hassles of strip driving during the day then maybe it is worth it. There is not much around, but there is a 24 hour bar across the street if you came to Vegas for that. Not me, but if you are sick of the strip or don't like people, this might be your spot. There are some food options, a food 4 less, and CVS for your convenience. If you have no car, this place would be pretty difficult as I hear cab fares are expensive to the action. I heard that the timeshare people were pretty annoying, but I didn't see any. I guess most people that stay here already have them, but some told us that the people still bothered them. Not sure how the price/experience would be if you didn't have a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Short but pleasant trip”
Reviews.Author: Motosierra
Reviews.Content: After visiting San Francisco for two nights, my wife and I came to Las Vegas and the Cancun Resort for two nights, before heading home and me going back to Baghdad. We were greeted very warmly at the front desk and received our room promptly. After checking in, my wife complained that the room had a funny smell and housekeeping came quickly to check and spray the whole suite with deodorizer which took care of the problem. The one room suite was a little on the small size, with a very cramped kitchen, bedroom and living room, but the bathroom was very roomy. The Jacuzzi tub didn’t have a stopper, so we were only able to take showers, but that was no biggie. The furnishings seemed a little dated and worn, but serviceable. We had reserved a car through a family friend employed by one of the major car-rental companies and they couldn’t find our reservation, so we wound taking a taxi to the resort. The concierge was very helpful in arranging a car at a good rate through Enterprise for us for a day, so we could take a site-seeing trip to Hoover Dam. The rest of the time we used the shuttle service, which was adequate, although not as timely as advertised. The driver actually remembered us from one day to the next, and was very helpful in getting us to the show we were going to see and getting us back to the resort afterwards. We didn’t have a chance to use the pool as it was a little cool the few days we were there, but it did look very nice.
